پس مردود است به اینکه : کلام محقق خواجه ( رحمه الله ) صریح است در اینکه این کلام حق انتظام هر دو امام عالی مقام - اعنی حضرت حسنین ( علیهما السلام ) - در حق ابوبکر ، در اول خلافت ، بعد از وقوع ‹ 18 › بیعت صادر گردیده ، و در “ صحیح بخاری “ و “ صحیح مسلم “ در قصه فدک مذکور است که حضرت امیرالمؤمنین ( علیه السلام ) و بنی هاشم تا مدت حیات حضرت فاطمه ( علیها السلام ) - که مدت شش ماه بود - بیعت ابوبکر نکردند ، تا به گزاردن نماز در عقب او و خطبه جمعه او را مسلم داشتن چه رسد !

Therefore, it is refuted by the fact that: the statement of Muhaqqiq Khwajah (may Allah have mercy on him) is explicit in that this statement – claimed to be from both of the noble Imams, i.e., Imam Hasan and Imam Husain (peace be upon them)– regarding Abu Bakr, was issued at the beginning of the caliphate, after the occurrence of the alleged pledge of allegiance. <18> Yet, in Sahih al-Bukhari and Sahih Muslim, in the story of Fadak, it is mentioned that the Commander of the Faithful (peace be upon him) and Banu Hashim did not pledge allegiance to Abu Bakr for the entire lifetime of Lady Fatimah (peace be upon her) – which was a period of six months – let alone praying behind him or acknowledging his Friday sermon!

پس انکار جناب امام حسن ( علیه السلام ) و امام حسین ( علیه السلام ) بر خطبه خواندن ابوبکر بر منبر رسول خدا ( صلی الله علیه وآله و سلم ) موافق و مطابق انکار حضرت امیرالمؤمنین ( علیه السلام ) باشد ، نه مخالف ، و الفاظ حدیث مذکور ، بر سبیل حذف و اختصار از صدر و عجز ، این است :

Therefore, the denial of Imam Hasan (peace be upon him) and Imam Husain (peace be upon him) regarding Abu Bakr's delivering sermons on the pulpit of the Messenger of Allah (Blessings of Allah be upon him and his holy progeny) should be seen as consistent and in accordance with the denial of the Commander of the Faithful (peace be upon him), not opposing it, and the words of the mentioned hadith, in a manner of brevity and abbreviation, from the beginning and the end, are as follows:

فوجدت فاطمة [سلام الله عليها] على أبي بكر في ذلك، فهجرته، فلم تكلمه حتى ماتت، وعاشت بعد النبي صلى الله عليه وآله وسلم ستة أشهر، فلما توفيت دفنها زوجها على ليلاً، ولم يؤذن بها أبا بكر، وصلى عليها، وكان لعلي [عليه السلام] من الناس وجه حياة فاطمة [سلام الله عليها]، فلما توفيت استنكر على [عليه السلام] وجوه الناس فالتمس مصالحة أبي بكر ومبايعته، ولم يكن يبايع تلك الأشهر. * انتهى بقدر الحاجة.

So, Fatimah (peace be upon her) was angered with Abu Bakr over that matter and shunned him; she did not speak to him until she passed away. She lived for six months after the Prophet (peace be upon him and his holy progeny). When she died, her husband Ali (peace be upon him) buried her at night, and did not inform Abu Bakr, and he led the prayer over her. Ali (peace be upon him) had a standing among the people during the lifetime of Fatimah (peace be upon her), but when she passed away, the faces of the people became unfamiliar to him. So, he sought reconciliation with Abu Bakr and gave him the pledge of allegiance, though he had not pledged those [previous] months. (100) Thus ends this portion as needed.

footnote.p: 1- [ ب ] صحیح البخاری 5 / 20 ; صحیح مسلم 3 / 138 . [ صحیح بخاری 5 / 82 - 83 ( طبع دارالفکر بیروت ) ; صحیح مسلم 5 / 154 ( طبع دارالفکر بیروت ) ] .
(100) [B] Sahih al-Bukhari 5/20; Sahih Muslim 3/138. [Sahih al-Bukhari 5/82-83 (Dar al-Fikr, Beirut edition); Sahih Muslim 5/154 (Dar al-Fikr, Beirut edition)].

para.p: و شمه ای از اقوال آن حضرت ، متضمن انکار خلافت ابوبکر در ضمن کلام سیدنا و مولانا میرباقر داماد ( رحمه الله ) گذشت ، و بعد از این نیز ان شاءالله تعالی در مقام مناسب بیاید .

A glimpse of the sayings of that holy figure, implying the denial of Abu Bakr's caliphate, was included in the words of our master and lord, Mir Baqar Damad (may Allah have mercy on him), and it will also be mentioned later, God willing, in a suitable context.
اما آنچه گفته : بر تقدیر ثانی هیچ نقصانی پیدا نمیکند . . . الی آخر .
As for what he said: that it does not imply any deficiency in the second Divine Decree... until the end.
پس مجاب است به اینکه : دانستی که فرض تقدیر ثانی ، در اقوال و افعال برگزیدگان درگاه ربانی ، دلیل جهل و نادانی ، بلکه برهان ناصبیت و بی ایمانی این مرد عثمانی و مروانی است .

It is refuted by saying: You have now understood that even assuming the second scenario, when applied to the words and actions of those chosen by the Divine Decree (of Allah), is itself a proof of ignorance and foolishness – nay, rather, it is a clear sign of the fanatic enmity (Nasb) and disbelief (Kufr) of this follower of Uthman and Marwaan.
اما آنچه گفته : قاعده اطفال است . . . الی قوله : احکام بشریت و خواص صبا و طفولیت . . . الی آخر .
As for what he said: “It is the rule of children…” up to his words: “…the laws of human nature and the characteristics of youth and childhood…” until the end.
پس مرود است به چند وجه :
It is rejected on several grounds:

اول : آنکه اطفال اهل بیت رسالت ( علیهم السلام ) و خاندان نبوت را با اطفال سایر ناس قیاس کردن ، دلیل جهل و وسواس این نسناس حق ناشناس است ; زیرا که معروف و مشهور گشته که جناب امیر ( علیه السلام ) فرموده :

First: Comparing the children of the Ahlul Bayt of the Prophet (peace be upon them) and the noble household of Revelation to the children of the rest of mankind is proof of the ignorance and warped thinking of this ungrateful, senseless creature. For it is well known and widely reported that His Excellency, the Commander of the Faithful (peace be upon him) said:
«نحن أهل بيت لا نقاس بالناس، ما عادانا بيت إلا خرب، وما نبح علينا كلب إلا جرب» (101) .
"We are the People of the House, who cannot be compared with others. No house but ours has prospered, and no dog has barked at us without getting afflicted by mange" (101).

footnote.p: 1- قسمت « لا نقاس بالناس » در مصادر زیر آمده : الخصائص ابن بطریق : 225 ، شواهد التنزیل 2 / 272 ، ملحقات احقاق الحق 20 / 27 ، مناقب ابن شهرآشوب 2 / 266 ، غایة المرام 3 / 297 ، و 4 / 107 ، بحار الأنوار 25 / 384 و 26 / 153 و 38 / 8 و . . . و بخش دوم حدیث با کمی اختلاف در : ریاض السالکین ( شرح سید علی خان بر صحیفه ) 1 / 38 ، بحار الأنوار 107 / 31 ، الکنی والالقاب 1 / 410 آمده است .

(101) The part "not to be compared with others" is found in the following sources: Al-Khisas al-'Ilmiyyah Ibn Batriq: 225, Shawahid al-Tanzil 2 / 272, Mulhaqat Ihqaq al-Haqq 20 / 27, Manaqib Ibn Shahraashub 2 / 266, Ghayat al-Maram 3 / 297, and 4 / 107, Bihaar al-Anwaar 25 / 384 and 26 / 153 and 38 / 8, etc., and the second part of the hadith, with slight variations, is found in: Riyaz al-Salekeen (Sharh Sayyid Ali Khan on Sahifah) 1 / 38, Behar al-Anwar 107 / 31, al-Kuniy wa'l-Alqab 1 / 410.

para.p: حاصل معنای این حدیث شریف آن است که : ما اهل بیت رسالت ( علیهم السلام ) با سایر ناس قیاس کرده نمیشویم ، و دشمن نداشته ما را خانواده ای مگر اینکه خراب شد ، و بلند نکرد بر ما هیچ سگی نباح و آواز خود را مگر اینکه گرگین گردید .

The essence of the meaning of this noble hadith is that: We, the Ahlul Bait of the Prophet (peace be upon them), cannot be compared to the rest of the people; and no family that bore enmity toward us was spared from ruin; and no dog ever raised its bark or voice against us except that it became diseased with mange.
و علی بن محمد معروف به ابن الصباغ (1) در کتاب “ فصول مهمه فی معرفة الائمة “ در حال امام حسین ( علیه السلام ) گفته :
Ali ibn Muhammad, known as Ibn al-Sabbagh (102), said in the book "Fusul Muhimmah fi Ma'rifat al-A'immah" regarding Imam Husain (peace be upon him):

footnote.p: 1- [ الف و ب ] شمس الدین محمد بن عبدالرحمن السخاوی المصری که تلمیذ ابن حجر عسقلانی است ; در کتاب “ ضوء لامع “ [ الضوء اللامع 5 / 283 ] گفته : علی بن محمد بن أحمد بن عبد الله نور الدین الأسفاقسی الغری الأصل ، المکی المالکی ، ویعرف ب : ابن الصباغ ، ولد فی العشر الأول من ذی الحجّة سنة أربع وثمانین وسبع مائة بمکّة ونشأ بها ، فحفظ القرآن والرسالة فی الفقه وألفیة ابن مالک وعرضهما علی الشریف عبد الرحمن الفاسی وعبد الوهاب بن العفیف الیافعی والجمال بن ظهیرة وقرینه أبی [ ابن ] السعود ، وسعد النووی ، وعلی بن محمد بن أبی بکر الشیبی ، و محمد بن أبی بکر بن سلیمان البکری ; وأجازوا له ، وأخذ الفقه عن أولهم ، والنحو عن الجلال عبد الواحد المرشدی ، وسمع علی الزین المراغی سداسیات الرازی . وله مؤلفات منها : الفصول المهمة لمعرفة الأئمة ، وهم إثنا عشر . انتهی ملتقطا . و فاضل رشید در “ ایضاح لطافة المقال “ در تعداد مصنفات علمای خود [ شان ] که در فضایل اهل بیت ( علیهم السلام ) تصنیف کرده اند گفته : و شیخ نورالدین علی بن محمد بن الصباغ المکی نیز در “ فصول مهمه فی معرفة ائمه “ ، از کتب اهل سنت فضائل آن حضرات نقل کرده است . [ ب : ( حامد حسین ) ] . [ ایضاح لطافة المقال : وانظر : کشف الظنون 2 / 1271 ، مقدمة الفصول المهمة فی معرفة الائمة ، لاسیما صفحات 14 - 25 ] .

(102) * [A and B] Shams al-Din Muhammad ibn Abdul Rahman al-Sakhawi al-Misri, a student of Ibn Hajar al-Asqalani, stated in his book "Zhu' al-Lame'" (The Radiant Light) [Zhu' al-Lame' 5 / 283]: Ali ibn Muhammad ibn Ahmad ibn Abdullah Nur al-Din al-Asfaqasi, of GharI origin, resident of Mecca, Maliki, known as Ibn al-Sabbagh, was born in the first ten days of Zul-Hijjah in the year 487 AH in Mecca and grew up there. He memorized the Quran and the Risalah in jurisprudence, as well as Ibn Malik's Alfiyah, and he presented them to Sharif Abdul Rahman al-Fasi, Abdul Wahhab ibn al-Afif al-Yaafi'i, al-Jamal ibn Zahirah, and his contemporaries, Abu [Ibn] Saud, Sa'd al-Nawawi, Ali ibn Muhammad ibn Abi Bakr al-Shaibi, and Muhammad ibn Abi Bakr ibn Sulayman al-Bakri. They all granted him permission (ijazah), and he studied jurisprudence with the first of them and grammar with Jalal Abdul Wahid al-Marghidi, and he heard the Six Books from Ali al-Zain al-Maraghii. He authored several works, including: "Al-Fusul al-Muhimmah fi Ma'rifat al-A'immah," and they are twelve. End of the excerpt. Fazil Rashid mentioned in "Izdah Latafat al-Maqal" (Clarification of the Subtlety of the Statement) the number of works by his scholars [their state] that have been written on the virtues of the Ahlul Bayt (peace be upon them) and said: Shaikh Nur al-Din Ali ibn Muhammad ibn al-Sabbagh al-Makki also compiled in "Fusul Muhimmah fi Ma'rifat A'immah," from the books of Ahle Tasannun the virtues of those revered individuals. [B: (Hamed Husain)]. [Izdah Latafat al-Maqal: And see: Kashf al-Zunun 2 / 1271, Introduction to Al-Fusul al-Muhimmah fi Ma'rifat al-A'immah, especially pages 14-25].

para.p: قال بعض أهل العلم: علوم أهل البيت [عليهم السلام] لا تتوقف على التكرار والدرس، ولا يزيد يومهم فيها على ما كان في الأمس؛ لأنهم المخاطبون في أسرارهم، المحدّثون في النفس، فسماء معارفهم وعلومهم بعيدة عن الإدراك واللمس، ومن أراد سترها كان كمن أراد ستر وجه الشمس؛ وهذا مما يجب أن يكون ثابتاً مقرراً في النفس، فهم يرون عالم الغيب في عالم الشهادة، ويقفون على حقائق المعارف في خلوات العبادة، وتناجيهم ثواقب أفكارهم في أوقات أذكارهم بما تسموا (103) به غارب الشرف والسيادة، وحصلوا بصدق توجههم جناب القدس ما بلغوا به منتهى السؤل (104) والإرادة، فهم كما في نفوس أوليائهم ومحبيهم وزيادة، فما تزيد معارفهم في زمان الشيخوخة على معارفهم في زمان الولادة.

Some scholars said: The knowledge of the Ahlul Bait (peace be upon them) does not depend on repetition and study, nor does their knowledge increase day by day; for they are the ones addressed with Divine secrets, those to whom truths are conveyed inwardly, so the heavens of their knowledge and gnosis far beyong the grasp and touch, and whoever seeks to conceal them is the like the one who tries to cover the face of the sun; and this is something that must be firmly established in the heart; they witness the unseen world while living in the visible world; they comprehend the realities of Divine Knowledge in their moments of worshipful solitude; their piercing thoughts whisper to them during their times of remembrance <19> through which they attained (103) the peak of nobility and leadership, and through the sincerity of their devotion, they reached the sacred presence (of Allah) – achieving through it the utmost end of all aspiration (104) and desire. They are as in the hearts of their devotees and lovers, and more; thus, their knowledge in old age is no greater than what they possessed at the time of their birth.

footnote.p: 1- فی المصدر : ( تسنّموا ) .
(103) In the source: (they ascended).
2- فی المصدر : ( السؤال ) ، و ذکر ما هنا نسخة بدل هناک .
(104) In the source: (suʾaal), and a mention of what is here is a replacement for something stated elsewhere.

para.p: وهذه أمور تثبت لهم بالقياس والنظر، ومناقب واضحة الحجول بادية الغرر، ومزايا تشرق إشراق الشمس والقمر، وسجايا تزيّن عنوان التواريخ وعيونات الأثر، فما سألهم مستفيد أو ممتحن فوقفوا، ولا أنكر منكر أمراً من الأمور إلا علموا وعرفوا، ولا جرى معهم غيرهم في مضمار شرف إلا سبقوا، وقصر مجاروهم وتخلفوا (105)؛ سنة جرى عليها الذين تقدموا منهم، وأحسن أتباعهم الذين خلفوا ، وكم عانوا وافي (106) الجداد والجلاد أموراً فبلغوها بالرأي الأصيل، والصبر الجميل، فما استكانوا وما ضعفوا، فبهذا وأمثاله سمعوا (107) على الأمثال، وشرفوا تفتر (108) الشقاشق إذا هدرت شقاشقهم، وتصغى الأسماع إذا قال قائلهم، أو نطق ناطقهم، ويكسف الهوى إذا قيست (109) به خلائقهم، ويقف كل ساع عن شاوهم، فلا يدرك فالقهم، ويعجزه سائقهم (110) ... سجايا منحهم بها خالقهم، وأخبر بها صادقهم، فستر (111) بها أولياؤهم وأصادقهم (112)، وحزن لها مباينهم ومفارقهم.

These are matters that are firmly established for them through reasoning and reflection – clear virtues, marked by their noble lineage, and shining distinctions that radiate like the sun and the moon. Their traits adorn the titles of histories and the core of transmitted reports. Never has a seeker or questioner turned to them without receiving guidance, nor has any denier questioned a matter without them knowing and recognizing the truth of it. And none who competed with them in the field of nobility ever matched them; their rivals lagged behind and fell short (105); this has been the consistent path of those who preceded among them and the best of those who followed after. A pattern that was established among those who preceded them and the best of their followers who remained, how much they endured in the fields of martyrdom (106) and the trials, dealing with matters, and they conveyed them with clear reasoning, and beautiful patience, so they were neither subdued nor weakened. Thus, with this and similar things, they were heard (107) regarding examples, and they were honored as the speech (108) itself is humbled when their tongues move, and ears incline attentively when one of them spoke, or uttered words, and desires are eclipsed (109) when compared against their character traits, and every ambitious seeker halts at their level, unable to surpass their excellence or even match their pace (110) these were qualities their Creator granted them, and their Truthful Prophet informed us of, so He protected (111) through them His friends and companions (112), while their enemies and those who parted from them are left in sorrow.

footnote.p: 3- فی المصدر : ( محاورهم وتحلقوا ) .
(105) In the source: (muhaawaruhum wa Tahallaqu) - "their disputants, and they dispersed".

(106) In the source: fi instead of waafi (likely a scribal simplification).
2- فی المصدر : ( سمّوا ) ، وهو الظاهر .
(107) In the source: In the source: summu – "they were named" (appears more correct in context)
3- فی المصدر : ( تقرّ ) .
(108) In the source: In the source: taqarra – “it settles” instead of taftiru – “it falters”.
4- فی المصدر : ( ویکشف الهوی إذا أفلست )
(109) In the source: In the source: wa-yakshifu al-hawa idha aflasat – "desire is exposed when it goes bankrupt"
5- فی المصدر : ( فلا یدرک فائتهم ولا ینال طرائقهم ) .
(110) In the source: fa-laa yudrik faa’itahum wa-laa yanaal taraa’iqahum – “None can catch their forerunners, nor reach their ways.”

para.p: حل الحسين [عليه السلام] من هذا البيت الشريف في أوجهه ويفاعه (113)، وعلا محله فيه علواً تقاصرت (114) النجوم عن ارتفاعه، واطلع بصفاء سرّه على غوامض المعارف، فانكشفت له الحقايق عند اطلاعه، وسار صيته بالفواضل والفضائل، فاستوى الصديق والعدو في استماعه ، [ولما انقسمت غنائم المجد حصل على صعابها ومرتاعه] (115) ، فقد اجتمع فيه وفي أخيه من خلال الفضل ما لا خلاف في اجتماعه، وكيف لا يكونان كذلك وهما ابنا علي وفاطمة وسبطان لمن هو سيد النبيين والمرسلين وخاتمهم [ﷺ] *.

Al-Husain (peace be upon him) dwelled within this noble house – in its finest aspects and highest heights (113); and his station therein was exalted to a degree that the stars themselves fell short of reaching his elevation (114), and he perceived, with the purity of his innermost soul, the depths of Divine Knowledge, and realities were unveiled to him as he gazed upon them, and his reputation spread far and wide for his virtues and perfections, such that both friend and foe alike were eager to listen to his words [and when the spoils of glory were divided, he attained its most difficult and vast portions] (115), indeed, in him and his brother were combined all traits of excellence – without any dispute among people regarding that. And how could it be otherwise, when they are the sons of Ali and Fatimah, and the two grandsons of the one who is the Master of the Prophets and Messengers, and their Seal (peace be upon him and his holy progeny)? (116)

footnote.p: 8- فی المصدر : ( أوجه وارتفاعه ) .
(113) In the source: awjih wa irtifaaʿih – “his noble aspects and height”
9- فی المصدر : ( تطامنت ) .
(114) In the source: tataamanat – “the stars lowered themselves” instead of taqasarat – “fell short”
1- الزیادة من المصدر و [ ب ] .
(115) The addition is from the source and [B].
2- [ ب ] الفصول المهمة : 601 ( طبع النجف الأشرف ) . [ الفصول المهمة 2 / 763 - 764 ] .
(116) * [B] al-Fusul al-Muhimmah: 601 (Najaf Ashraf edition). [al-Fusul al-Muhimmah 2 / 763 - 764].

para.p: هرگاه به اعتراف اهل سنت علوم اهل بیت ( علیهم السلام ) بر کسب و تعلم موقوف نبود ، بلکه علوم ایشان علوم لدُنیّه الهامیه باشد ، و در زمان ولادت و شیخوخت ایشان تفاوتی نباشد ، و در حالت طفولیت جامع کمالاتی باشند که عقل از ادراک آن قاصر است ، و با وجود صغرِ سن بر مشایخ کبار فایق و سابق باشند ، باز قیاس نمودن حال حسنین ( علیهما السلام ) را بر حال دیگر اطفال نهایت سفاهت ، بلکه کمال نصب و عداوت است !

When it is acknowledged by the scholars of Ahle Tasannun that the knowledge of the Ahlul Bayt (peace be upon them) was not contingent upon acquisition and learning, but rather their knowledge was of a Divinely bestowed and inspired nature, with no distinction between the time of their birth and their old age, and they were embodied with perfections in their state of childhood that the intellect is incapable of comprehending, and despite their young age, they were superior and preceding to the elders, still to compare the state of Hasan and Husain (peace be upon them both) to that of other children is the height of folly, and indeed, the pinnacle of enmity and opposition!
دوم : آنکه فخر رازی (3) در “ نهایة العقول “ در مقام ابطال نص بر امامت جناب امیر ( علیه السلام ) گفته :
Second: That Fakhr al-Razi (117) in "Nihayat al-Uqool" speaks in the context of refuting the explicit text on the Imamate of the Commander of the Faithful (peace be upon him) said:

footnote.p: 3- [ الف و ب ] قال الیافعی فی وقایع سنة ست وست مائة : وفیها توفّی الإمام الکبیر ، العلامة النحریر ، الأُصولی المتکلم ، المناظر المفسّر ، صاحب التصانیف المشهورة فی الآفاق ، الحظیّة فی سوق الإفادة بالاتفاق . . فخر الدین الرازی أبو عبد الله محمد بن عمر بن حسین القرشی التیمی البکری ، الملّقب ب : الإمام عند علماء الأُصول ، المقرّر لشُبه مذاهب الفرق المخالفین ، والمبطل لها بإقامة البراهین ، الطبرستانی الأصل ، الرازی المولد ، الشافعی المذهب ، فرید عصره ، ونسیج دهره . انتهی مختصراً . [ مرآة الجنان 4 / 7 ] . وقد ذکره قاضی القضاة شمس الدین ابن خلّکان فی وفیات الأعیان ، والسبکی فی طبقاته الکبری ، وابن شهبة فی “ طبقات الفقهاء الشافعیة “ . . وغیرهم فی غیرها . ( 12 ) . [ انظر : وفیات الأعیان 4 / 248 - 249 ، طبقات الشافعیة الکبری 8 / 81 - 82 ، طبقات الشافعیة لابن شهبة 2 / 65 ] .

(117) * [A and B] Al-Yafi'i said in "Waqa'i' Sanat Sitt wa Sist Mi'ah": "And in it, the great Imam, the scholar of eloquence, the usuli theologian, the debater, the interpreter, the author of well-known writings across the horizons, and one esteemed in the marketplace of knowledge, passed away... Fakhr al-Din al-Razi, Abu Abdullah Muhammad ibn Umar ibn Husain al-Qurashi al-Taymi al-Bukari, titled 'the Imam' by the scholars of usul, the one who articulated the arguments of the differing sects, and refuted them by establishing proofs, of Tabaristani origin, born in Rayy, Shafi'i in sect, a unique figure of his era, and a remarkable personality of his time." This ends the summary. [Mir'at al-Janan 4 / 7]. And he was mentioned by Qazi al-Qozat Shams al-Din Ibn Khallikan in "Wafayat al-A'yaan," and al-Subki in "Tabaqat al-Kubra," and Ibn Shahabah in "Tabqat al-Fuqaha al-Shafi'iyyah"... and others in various contexts. (12). [See: Wafayat al-A'yaan 4 / 248 - 249, Tabqat al-Shafi'iyyah al-Kubra 8 / 81 - 82, Tabqat al-Shafi'iyyah by Ibn Shahabah 2 / 65].

para.p: وكيف نقل عن الحسن [عليه السلام] أنه قال لأبي بكر: «انزل عن منبر أبي»؛ ونقل خصومة فاطمة [سلام الله عليها] في فدك؛ وما كان من تأخر علي [عليه السلام] والزبير وخالد بن سعيد بن العاص عن البيعة مدة، مع أنه لم يذكر أحد في شيء من المجامع (118) ذلك النص . (119) انتهى.

And how can it be reported from al-Hasan (peace be upon him) that he said to Abu Bakr, "Descend from my father's pulpit" ; and the dispute of Fatimah (peace be upon her) regarding Fadak ; and what occurred with the delay of Ali (peace be upon him) and Zubair and Khalid ibn Sa'id ibn al-As from the allegiance for a time, <20> while no one mentioned in any of the assemblies (118) the text (119). End.

footnote.p: 1- فی المصدر : ( المجامیع ) .
(118) In the source: (al-majami' - compilations)
2- نهایة العقول ، ورق : 258 ، صفحه : 521 .
(119) Nahayat al-‘Uqool, page 258, volume 521.

para.p: و سیاق کلام رازی دلالت صریحه دارد بر آنکه کلام حضرت امام حسن ( علیه السلام ) از قبیل ردّ و انکار است ، نه حرکات اطفال صغار ، والله الموفق للاستبصار ، والعاصم من زلل الأفکار وخطأ الأنظار .

And the context of Raazi's words clearly indicates that the statement of Imam al-Hasan (peace be upon him) is of the nature of rejection and denial, not the actions of small children. Allah is the Granter of Insight, and He is the Protector from the slips of thoughts and the errors of perceptions.

سوم : آنکه از روایاتی که نقل کردیم معلوم میشود که جناب امیر ( علیه السلام ) بر امام حسن ( علیه السلام ) انکاری نفرمود ; حال آنکه آن جناب در آن وقت تشریفمیداشت ، و تقریر جناب امیر ( علیه السلام ) بالاجماع معتبر است .

Third: From the narrations we have mentioned, it becomes clear that the noble Amir (peace be upon him) did not object to Imam Hasan (peace be upon him); while the noble Amir (peace be upon him) was present at that time, and his silence and approval (taqreer) is, by consensus, considered authoritative.

و کلمه : « والله ما هذا من أمری » مفید انکار بر کلام امام حسن ( علیه السلام ) نیست ، بلکه غرض از آن این است که : این کلام آن حضرت به تعلیم جناب امیر ( علیه السلام ) واقع نشده ، و از این معنا منکَر دانستن آن حضرت ( علیه السلام ) این کلام را هرگز مستفاد نیست .

And the statement: "By Allah, this is not from my command" does not imply denial of the words of Imam Hasan (peace be upon him and his holy progeny); rather, the intention behind it is that: the words of that Blessed One were not realized through the instruction of the Noble Amir (peace be upon him and his holy progeny), and from this understanding, the denial of that Blessed One (peace be upon him and his holy progeny) regarding this statement is never to be inferred.
اما آنچه گفته : بلکه قبل از اربعین منصب نبوت به کسی عطا نشد .
As for what he said: Rather, no one was granted the position of Prophethood before the age of forty.
پس مردود است به چند وجه :
Then it is refuted in several ways:
اول : آنکه آنچه ذکر کرده دعوای محض است ، دلیلی بر آن اقامه نکرده .
First: What he has mentioned is mere assertion, and he has not provided any evidence for it.

دوم : آنکه اگر بالفرض کسی از انبیا قبل از اربعین (1) نبوت عطا نشده باشد ، از آن عدم اعتبار اقوال و افعال ائمه [ ( علیهم السلام ) ] در حال صغر سن لازم نمیآید ، و الا لازم آید که قبل از اربعین مطلقاً افعال و اقوال این حضرات معتبر نباشد ، ولعلّه لایرضی به الناصب باللسان ، وإن کان یعتقده - بل أشنع منه - بالجنان .

Second: That even if, hypothetically, no one from the Prophets was granted Prophethood before the age of forty (120), this does not entail that the sayings and actions of the Imams (peace be upon them) are not reliable during their childhood; otherwise, it would follow that the actions and sayings of these esteemed ones would be altogether invalid before the age of forty, and perhaps the enemies of Ahlul Bayt would not be pleased with this verbally, even if they believed it – rather, something more abhorrent – in their hearts.

footnote.p: 1- [ الف و ب ] و واضعین در این باب حدیثی هم ساخته اند ، لیکن ناقدین به تفضیحشان پرداخته ، سیوطی در رساله “ درر منتثره “ میآرد : ( ما من نبیّ إلاّ بعد الأربعین ) ، قال ابن الجوزی : موضوع . ( 12 ) . [ الدرر المنتثرة 164 ، گر چه همین مطلب را از ابن جوزی ، عجلونی در کشف الخفاء 2 / 194 و صالحی شامی در سبل الهدی والرشاد 2 / 226 نقل کرده اند ، ولی در الموضوعات ابن جوزی پیدا نکردیم ] .

(120) * [A and B] have also fabricated a hadith in this regard, but critics have dealt with their condemnation, and Suyuti mentions in his treatise "Durar Muntasirah": (There is no Prophet except after the age fo forty), Ibn al-Jawzi said: Fabricated (Mawdu'). (12). [Durar Muntathirah 164, although we found that ‘Ajluni and Salihi Shami have also narrated the same thing from Ibn al-Jawzi in their works, Kasha al-Khafa 2 / 194 and Sabil al-Huda wa al-Rashad 2 / 226 respectively, we did not find it in the Mawdu'at (Fabrications) of Ibn al-Jawzi].

para.p: سوم : آنکه به حضرت یحیی و حضرت عیسی ( علیهما السلام ) منصب نبوت در حال صغر سن و طفولیت عطا شده ; چنانچه حق تعالی شأنه در قرآن مجید ، در حق یحیی فرموده : ( وَآتَیْناهُ الْحُکْمَ صَبِیّاً ) (1) یعنی : دادیم یحیی را حکمت در سن طفلی .

Third: That the position of Prophethood was granted to Prophet Yahya and Prophet Isa (peace be upon them both) while they were in a state of young age and childhood, as Almighty Allah, said concerning Prophet Yahya, ﴿وَآتَيْنَاهُ الْحُكْمَ صَبِيًّا﴾ (121) meaning: We granted Yahya wisdom while he was still a child.

footnote.p: 1- سورة مریم ( 19 ) : 12 .
(121) Surah Maryam (19): 12.

para.p: و نیز حق تعالی در حق عیسی ( علیه السلام ) فرموده :
And likewise, Almighty Allah stated regarding Isa (peace be upon him):

(قالُوا کَیْفَ نُکَلِّمُ مَنْ کانَ فِی الْمَهْدِ صَبِیّاً * قالَ إِنِّی عَبْدُ اللّهِ آتانِیَ الْکِتابَ وَجَعَلَنِی نَبِیّاً * وَجَعَلَنِی مُبارَکاً أَیْنَ ما کُنْتُ وَأَوْصانِی بِالصَّلاةِ وَالزَّکاةِ ما دُمْتُ حَیّاً) (122).
But she pointed to him. They said: How should we speak to one who was a child in the cradle? He said: Surely, I am a servant of Allah; He has given me the Book and made me a prophet;

footnote.p: (122) Surah Maryam (19): 29-31.

para.p: و زمخشری (3) صاحب “ کشاف “ در تفسیر این آیه گفته :
And Zamakhshari (123), the author of "Kashaf," said in the interpretation of this verse:

footnote.p: 3- [ الف و ب ] مخفی نماند که زمخشری صاحب کشاف از اعاظم مفسرین و اکابر محدّثین اهل سنت است . و قاضی القضات ابن خلّکان [ وفیات الأعیان 5 / 168 ] ، و یافعی در “ مرآة الجنان “ [ 3 / 269 ] ، و عبدالقادر در طبقات حنفیه مسمّی ب : “ جواهر مضیئه “ [ 2 / 160 ] ، و کفوی در کتاب “ أعلام الأخیار “ ، و سیوطی در “ بغیة الوعاة “ [ 2 / 280 ] ، و صاحب “ مفتاح کنز الدرایة “ ، و جزری صاحب “ نهایه “ ; او را به مناقب جلیله و مدایح جمیله ستوده اند . و آنچه فاضل ناصب - از راه عدم اطلاع - درباره او در باب کیود خود گفته [ تحفه اثناعشریه : 41 ] ، ردّ و نقض آن ، مصنّف قمقام ، - اعلی الله مقامه فی دارالسلام ، به اَبین وجوه بیان کرده [ تقلیب المکائد : 196 - 197 ] . در “ جامع الأُصول “ میفرماید : أبو القاسم محمود بن عمر الزمخشری الخوارزمی الحنفی مذهباً صاحب التصانیف العجیبة والتألیفات الغریبة ; مثل : الفائق فی غریب الحدیث ، والکشّاف فی تفسیر القرآن ، والأمثال ، والمفصّل فی النحو . . وله الید الباسطة واللسان الفصیح فی علوم الأدب ولغتها ونحوها وشعرها ، ورسائلها وعلم البیان ; إلیه انتهت هذه الفضائل و به ختمت ، وأقام مکّة دهراً حتّی صار یعرف ب : جارالله . [ جامع الاصول : 15 / 300 - 301 ] . و در کتاب “ روض المناظر فی علم الاوائل والأواخر “ تألیف قاضی القضات شیخ محبّ الدین ، ابوالولید ، محمد بن محمد بن الشحنة الحنفی الحلبی در وقایع سنة ثمان وثلاثین و خمس مائة گفته : وفیها توفّی أبو القاسم محمد بن عمر الزمخشری ومولده فی رجب سنة سبع وستین واربع مائة ; وزمخشر : قریة من قری خوارزم ، وفضائله وتصانیفه أشهر من أن تذکر . ( 12 ) . [ روض المناظر ، ورق : 149 ] .

(123) * [A and B] It should not be hidden that Zamakhshari, the author of "Kashaf," is one of the most prominent exegetes and significant narrators of the Ahle Tasannun. And Qazi al-Qozat Ibn Khallikan [Wafiyat al-A'yaan 5/168], and Yahfi in "Mir'at al-Janaan" [3/269], and Abd al-Qadir in the Hanbali texts titled "Jawahir Mudi'ah" [2/160], and Kafwi in the book "A'lam al-Akhiyar," and Suyaṭi in "Bughiyat al-Wa'aat" [2/280], and the author of "Miftah Kanz al-Darayah," and Jazari, the author of "Nihayah," have praised him for his noble merits and beautiful eulogies. And what the biased scholar - out of ignorance - has said about him regarding his limitations [Tuhfat Ithna 'Ashariyyah: 41] is refuted and countered by the author of Qumqam, - may Allah exalt his station in the Abode of Peace, explaining it in clearer ways [Taqlib al-Makayid: 196-197]. In "Jami' al-Ulum," it is stated: Abu al-Qasim Mahmud ibn Umar al-Zamakhshari al-Khwarizmi, of Hanafite creed, the author of remarkable writings and strange compositions; such as: "al-Fa'iq fi Gharib al-Hadith," and "al-Kashaf fi Tafsir al-Quran," and "al-Amthal," and "al-Mufassal fi al-Nahw." . . And he had a broad hand and eloquent tongue in the sciences of literature, its language, grammar, poetry, and rhetoric; these virtues culminated in him and were perfected through him, and he remained in Mecca for an age until he became known as the Neighbor of Allah (Jaar Allaah). [Jami' al-Ulum: 15/300-301]. And in the book "Rawdat al-Manazir fi Ilm al-Awail wal-Awakhir," authored by Qazi al-Qodat Shaikh Muhibb al-Din, Abu al-Walid, Muhammad ibn Muhammad ibn al-Shuhna al-Hanafi al-Halabi, it is mentioned in the events of the year 538 AH: And in it, Abu al-Qasim Muhammad ibn Umar al-Zamakhshari passed away, and he was born in Rajab 466 AH; and Zamakhshar is a village in the region of Khwarizm, and his virtues and writings are more famous than to be mentioned. (12). [Rawdat al-Manazir, folio: 149]

para.p: واختلفوا في نبوته؛ فقيل: أعطيها في الطفولية وأكمل الله عقله واستنبأه طفلاً نظراً إلى ظاهر الآية *.

And they disagreed about his Prophethood; it was said: He was given it in childhood, and God perfected his intellect and called him as a prophet as a child, in consideration of the apparent meaning of the verse (124).

footnote.p: 1- [ ب ] الکشاف : 2 / 410 ( طبع مصر سنه 1354 ) . [ الکشاف : 2 / 508 ] .
(124) * [B] Al-Kashaf: 2 / 410 (Cairo edition, 1354). [Al-Kashaf: 2 / 508].

para.p: و در کتاب “ مواقف “ مذکور است :
And it is mentioned in the book "Mawaqif":

قد قال القاضي: إن عيسى كان نبياً في صباه لقوله تعالى: (وَجَعَلَنِي نَبِيّاً) (125)، ولا يمتنع من القادر المختار أن يخلق في الطفل ما هو شرط النبوة من كمال العقل وغيره. * انتهى. هو شرط النبوة من کمال العقل وغیره . (1) انتهی .

Al-Qazi said: Indeed, Jesus (peace be upon him) was a prophet in his youth, due to His Almighty statement: (and he made me a prophet) (125), and it is not impossible for the All-Powerful, the Wise, to create in a child what He is the condition of Prophethood from the perfection of intellect and other things. (126) End.

footnote.p: 2- سورة مریم ( 19 ) : 30 .
(125) Surah Maryam (19): 30.
1- [ الف ] در اوائل مقصد اول از مرصد اول از موقف سادس . [ ب ] شرح المواقف : 8 / 226 . [ المواقف : 3 / 339 ، 346 ] .
(126) [A] in the beginning of the first objective in the first observation of the sixth stance. [B] Sharh al-Mawaqif: 8/226. [Mawaqif: 3/339, 346].

para.p: و عمر بن عادل حنبلی در تفسیر “ لباب فی علوم الکتاب “ (2) در تفسیر این آیه گفته :
And Umar ibn Adil Hanbali in his interpretation “Labaab fi Uloom al-Kitaab” (127) has said regarding the interpretation of this verse:

footnote.p: 2- [ الف و ب ] ذکر عبد الوهاب الشعرانی فی شروع المیزان فی مقروءاته تفسیر اللباب فی علوم الکتاب لعمر بن عادل الحنبلی . وکانت النسخة الحاضرة عندی عتیقة ، وقد قوبلت العبارة علیها . ( 12 ) . [ المیزان الکبری الشعرانیة 1 / 92 ] .

(127) [A and B] Abd al-Wahhab al-Sh'arani mentioned in Sharh al-Meezan that the interpretation of Labaab fi Uloom al-Kitaab by Umar ibn Adil Hanbali was among his readings. The copy available to me was old, and the phrasing on it was verified. (12). [Mizan al-Kubra al-Sh'araniyya 1/92].

para.p: عن الحسن : إنه أُلهم التوراة وهو فی بطن أُمّه .
From al-Hasan: He was inspired with the Torah while in his mother's womb.

وقال الأکثرون: [إنه ] (128) أُوتی الإنجیل وهو صغیر طفل ، وکان یعقل عقل الرجال ; فمن قال : الکتاب هو التوراة ، قال : لأن الألف واللام للعهد ، ولا معهود حینئذ إلا التوراة ، و من قال : الإنجیل ، قال : الألف واللام للاستغراق ، وظاهر کلام عیسی [ ( علیه السلام ) ] : إن الله آتاه الکتاب وجعله نبیّاً وأمره بالصلاة والزکاة ، وأن یدعو إلی الله تعالی وإلی دینه وشریعته من قبل أن یکلّمهم ، فإنه تکلّم مع أُمّه وأخبرها بحاله ، وأخبرها بأنه یکلّمهم بما یدلّ علی برائتها ، فلهذا أشارت إلیه بالکلام .

And most said: [that he] (128) was given the Injeel as a small child, and he could understand like a man; thus, those who said the Book was the Torah, stated it was because the definite article (the) was for covenant, and nothing was known at that time except the Torah. And those who said the Injeel, argued that the definite article (the) was for totality. The apparent words of Prophet Isa [(peace be upon him)] are that Allah granted him the Book, made him a Prophet, and commanded him to pray and give alms, and to call to Allah, the Exalted, <21> and to His religion and Shari'ah before he would speak to them, for he spoke with his mother and informed her of his situation, and told her that he would speak to them in a way that would indicate her innocence. This is why she indicated to him to speak.

footnote.p: 3- الزیادة من المصدر .
(128) The addition is from the source.

para.p: قال بعضهم: أخبر أنه نبیّ ، ولکنه ما کان رسولا ; لأنه فی ذلک الوقت ما جاء بالشریعة ...
Some said: He was informed that he was a Prophet, but he was not a Messenger; because at that time, he did not bring the Shari'ah.
ومعنی کونه نبیّاً: أنه رفیع القدر، عالی الدرجة ; وهذا ضعیف ; لأنه قرن بذکر النبوة الشرع (129) وهو قوله : ( وَأَوْصانِی بِالصَّلاةِ وَالزَّکاةِ ) . (130) انتهی (131).

And the meaning of his being a prophet is that he is of lofty status, high rank; and this is weak, because it is linked to the mention of prophetic office in the Divine Law (Shari'ah) (129), which is his statement: (And he enjoined me to establish prayer and to give alms) (130). End (131).

footnote.p: 1- فی المصدر : ( لأن النبیّ فی عرف الشرع هو الذی خصّه الله بالنبوة وبالرسالة ، خصوصاً إذا قرن إلیه ذکر الشرع ) .

(129) In the source: (because a prophet in the understanding of the Law is one whom God has specially chosen for Prophethood and messengership, especially when the mention of the Law is coupled with it).
2- سورة مریم ( 19 ) : 31 .
(130) Surah Maryam (19): 31.
3- اللباب فی علوم الکتاب 13 / 58 .
(131) Al-Labab fi Ulum al-Kitab 13/58.

para.p: و به حضرت یوسف [ ( علیه السلام ) ] هم در حال صغر سنّ نبوت عطا شده چنانچه در “ تفسیر ابوحیان “ (4) مذکور است :
And to Prophet Yusuf (peace be upon him) also, Prophethood was granted in his youth, as mentioned in "Tafsir Abu Hayyan" (132):

footnote.p: 4- در [ الف ] اشتباهاً : ( ابن حیان ) آمده است .
(132) In [A] by mistake: (Ibn Hayyan) is mentioned.

para.p: [ إوالظاهر أن الضمیر فی ] (133) ( وَأَوْحَیْنا إِلَیْهِ ) (134) عاید علی یوسف [ ( علیه السلام ) ] ، وهو وحی إلهام ، قاله مجاهد .

[Or it appears that the pronoun in] (133) (And We inspired to him) (134) refers to Prophet Yusuf (peace be upon him), and it is a form of Divine revelation (wahy) or inspiration (ilham), said Mujahid.

footnote.p: 5- الزیادة من المصدر .
(133) Addition from the source.
6- سورة یوسف ( 12 ) : 15 .
(134) Surah Yusuf (12): 15.

para.p: و روی ابن عباس (رضی الله عنه) : أو منام .
Ibn Abbas (may Allah be pleased with him) narrated: Or a dream.
وقال الضحاک وقتادة: نزل علیه جبرئیل فی البئر.
And al-Duhhak and Qatadah said: Gabriel (Jibril) descended upon him in the well.
وقال الحسن: أعطاه الله النبوة فی الجبّ وکان صغیراً، کما أوحی إلی یحیی (علیه السلام) وعیسی ( علیه السلام ) وهو ظاهر ( أَوْحَیْنا ) (135) .

And al-Hasan said: God granted him Prophethood in the pit while he was still young, just as He inspired to Prophet Yahya (peace be upon him) and Prophet Isa (peace be upon him), and this is evident in (We inspired) (135).

footnote.p: 7- [ الف و ب ] سوره یوسف تفسیر آیه : ( وَأَوْحَیْنا إِلَیْهِ لَتُنَبِّئَنهُمْ بِأَمْرِهِمْ هذا وَهُمْ لا یَشْعُرُونَ ) . ( 12 ) . [ البحر المحیط 5 / 288 ] .
(135) [A and B] Surah Yusuf, interpretation of the verse: (And We inspired to him, 'You will surely inform them of this matter of yours while they do not perceive') (12:15). [Al-Bahr al-Muhit 5/288].

para.p: و جناب رسالت مآب ( صلی الله علیه وآله ) از حین ولادت - بلکه قبل از ولادت - متصف به وصف نبوت بوده ، چنانچه در “ شرح فقه اکبر “ (1) ملا علی قاری مذکور است :

And His Excellency, the Prophet of Mercy (peace be upon him and his holy progeny), from the time of his birth – indeed, even before his birth – has been endowed with the attribute of Prophethood, as mentioned in the "Sharh Fiqh Akbar" (136) by Mulla Ali Qari:

footnote.p: 1- [ الف و ب ] قال صاحب کشف الظنون عن أسامی الکتب والفنون [ 2 / 1287 ] - فی بیان شروح الفقه الأکبر - : وشرحه لمولانا علی القاری [ الأنصاری ] مجلد ، وسمّاه : المنهج الأزهر [ منح الأزهر ، خ ل : منح الروض الأزهر ] وهو شرح کبیر ممزوج ، أوله : الحمد لله واجب الوجود . . إلی آخره . ( 12 ) .

(136) [A and V] The author of Kashf al-Dhunoon said about the names of books and sciences [2 / 1287] - in the context of explaining the commentaries on Fiqh Akbar -: And his commentary is in one volume, named by our Master Ali Qari [al-Ansari]: Al-Manhaj al-Azhar [Minhah al-Azhar, Khl: Minhah al-Rawd al-Azhar], which is a large mixed commentary, beginning with: "Praise be to Allah, the Necessary Existent..." and so on. (12).

para.p: قال الإمام الرازی : الحق أن محمداً صلی الله علیه [ وآله ] وسلّم قبل الرسالة ما کان علی شرع نبیّ من الأنبیاء ، وهو المختار عند المحققین من الحنفیة ; لأنه لم یکن أُمّة نبیّ قطّ ، لکنه کان فی مقام النبوة قبل الرسالة ، وکان یعمل بما هو الحق الذی ظهر علیه فی مقام نبوته بالوحی الخفی ، والکشوف الصادقة من شریعة إبراهیم ( علیه السلام ) وغیرها .

Al-Imam al-Razi said: The truth is that Prophet Muhammad (peace be upon him [and his holy progeny]) did not follow the law (Shariah) of any Prophet from among the prophets before his declaration of Prophethood, and this is the view chosen by the experts among the Hanafis; for he was never a follower of a Prophet at any time, but he was on the station of Prophethood before the declaration of his Prophethood, and he would act according to the truth that manifested to him in his station of Prophethood through subtle revelation (wahy khafi) and true unveilings (kashf) from the Shariah of Abraham (peace be upon him) and others.

کذا نقله شارح (137) عمدة النسفی ; وفیه دلالة علی أن نبوته لم تکن منحصرة فیما بعد الأربعین کما قاله جماعة ، بل إشارة إلی أنه من یوم ولادته متصف بنعت نبوته ، بل یدلّ حدیث « کنت نبیّاً وآدم بین الروح والجسد » أنه متصف به وصف النبوة فی عالم الأرواح قبل خلق الأشباح ، وهذا وصف خاص له ; لا أنه محمول علی خلقه للنبوة واستعداده للرسالة کما یفهم من کلام حجة الاسلام ، فإنه حینئذ لایتمیز عن غیره حتّی یصلح أن یکون متمدحا بهذا النعت بین الأنام (138) .

Thus, it was conveyed by the commentator (137) of Umdah al-Nasafi; and this indicates that his Prophethood was not limited to what occurred after the age of forty, as stated by many, but rather it hints that from the day of his birth, he was endowed with the quality of Prophethood. Moreover, the narration “I was a Prophet while Adam was between spirit and body” indicates that he was endowed with the attribute of Prophethood in the world of souls before the creation of bodies, and this is a special attribute of his; it does not imply that he was merely prepared for Prophethood and ready for Mission, as can be understood from the words of the Proof (Hujjah) of Islam, for at that time it would not be distinguishable from anything else, until it would be suitable to be praiseworthy with this attribute among people (138).

footnote.p: 2- فی المصدر : ( القونوی فی شرح ) .
(137) In the source: (al-Qoonawi in Sharh).
1- منح الروض الأزهر فی شرح الفقه الأکبر : 179 - 180 .
(138) Minh al-Rawd al-Azhar fi Sharh al-Fiqh al-Akbar: 179-180.

para.p: و از امثال عرب آمده : .
And Arabs have a proverb:
من لم یسُد قبل الأربعین لم یُسد بعدها (139) .
Whoever is not made a leader before the age of forty, will not be made one afterward (139).

footnote.p: 2- لم نجدها فی کتب الأمثال .
(139) We could not find it in the books of proverbs.

para.p: اما آنچه گفته که : النادر فی حکم المعدوم .
As for what he said: The rare (al-nadir) is as the non-existent (al-ma'dum) in ruling.
پس قدح عقاید دینه و احکام شرعیة به امثال این امثال نتوان کرد .
Then one cannot criticize the beliefs of his religion and the legal rulings with such examples.
اما آنچه گفته : مثل مشهور است : الصبی صبی ولو کان نبیّاً (3) .
But what he has mentioned is a common saying: الصبی صبی ولو کان نبیّاً, (A child is a child even if he is a prophet) (140).

footnote.p: 3- لم نجدها فی کتب الأمثال ، ولعلّه ممّا هو مشهور علی ألسنة عوامهم .
(140) We could not find it in the books of proverbs, and perhaps it is something commonly known on the tongues of their common folk.

para.p: پس اگر این مثل صحیح باشد لازم آید که اعطای نبوت شخصی را در حال صبا ، عبث و لغو ، بلکه موجب تحقیر و تذلیل این مرتبه عالیه باشد .
So, if this example is correct, it would imply that granting Prophethood to a person in childhood would be frivolous and meaningless, rather diminishing and humiliating to this high rank.
و در حقیقت و فی الواقع عکس این مثل صحیح و راست است ، و آن این است : ( النبیّ نبیّ ولو کان صبیاً ) .
In truth and in reality, the opposite of this example is correct and true, and that is this: (النبیّ نبیّ ولو کان صبیاً), A prophet is a prophet even if he is a child.

و عجب است که مخاطب به این مثل مصنوع بر حط مرتبه سیدی شباب أهل الجنة ، و خفض درجه رسالت و نبوت تمسک جسته ، و آنچه شیخ سعدی در کتاب “ گلستان “ فرموده آن را فراموش کرده ‹ 22 › و آن این است : بزرگی به عقل است نه به سال (4) .

And it is astonishing that the one addressed by this manufactured example, clinging to the lowering of the rank of my master, the youth of the inhabitants of Paradise, and the reduction of the degree of messengership and Prophethood, has forgotten what Shaikh Saadi has stated in the book "Golestan" <22>, which is this: Greatness is due to intellect, not age (141).

footnote.p: 4- گلستان سعدی :
(141) Golestan Saadi:

para.p: و له ایضاً بیت :
And for him there is also a couplet:
کودکی کو به عقل پیر بود
A child who was wise beyond his years
نزد اهل خرد کبیر بود (142)
Among the people of understanding, he was great (142)

footnote.p: (142) Golestan-e Sa'di:

para.p: بدان که : در روایات اهل سنت مذکور است که جناب امام حسین ( علیه السلام ) ، به عمر بن خطاب نیز در خلافت او فرمود که : « از منبر پدر بزرگوار ما فرود آ [ ی ] » ; و او هم مثل ابوبکر جواب داد ، چنانچه در “ تهذیب الکمال “ (2) مذکور است :

Know that it is mentioned in the narrations of the Ahle Tasannun that His Excellency Imam Husain (peace be upon him), also said to Umar ibn Khattab during his caliphate: "Descend from the pulpit of my revered father"; and he, like Abu Bakr, answered, as mentioned in "Tahdhib al-Kamal" (143):

footnote.p: 2- [ الف و ب ] قال صاحب کشف الظنون عن اسامی الکتب والفنون : تهذیب الکمال لأسماء الرجال للحافظ جمال الدین یوسف بن زکی المزی المتوفی سنة اثنین واربعین وسبع مائة ، وهو کتاب کبیر لم یؤلف مثله ، لا یظنّ أن یستطاع . قیل : إنه لم یکمّله وأکمله علاءالدین مغلطای بن خلیج ( المتوفی سنة 662 ) فی ثلاثة عشر مجلدات [ کذا ] . انتهی مختصراً . [ انظر : کشف الظنون 2 / 1509 ] .

(143) [A and B] The author of Kashf al-Dhunun said about the titles of books and arts: Tahdhib al-Kamal fi Asma' al-Rijal by the hafiz Jamal al-Din Yusuf ibn Zaki al-Mizi, who died in 742 AH, is a large book, unmatched in its kind, and it is not believed that one could fully accomplish it. It is said that he did not complete it, and Alasd al-Din Mughaltay ibn Khaliq (who died in 662 AH) completed it in thirteen volumes [thus]. Ended briefly. [See: Kashf al-Dhunun 2 / 1509].

para.p: قال حماد بن زید : حدّثنا یحیی بن سعید ، عن عبید بن حسین ، حدّثنی حسین بن علی ( علیهما السلام ) قال : « أتیت عمر – وهو علی المنبر – فصعدت إلیه ، فقلت : « انزل عن منبر أبی واذهب إلی منبر أبیک » . فقال عمر : لم یکن لأبی منبر ; وأخذنی وأجلسنی معه ، فجعلت أُقلّب حصا بیدی ، فلمّا نزل انطلق بی إلی منزله ، فقال : من علّمک ؟ ! فقلت : « والله ما علّمنیه أحد » [ قال : یا بنی ! لو تغشّانا ] (144) .

Hammad ibn Zayd said: Yahya ibn Sa'id narrated to us, from Ubayd ibn Husain, who said: Husain ibn Ali (peace be upon them both) narrated to me, saying: "I went to Umar – while he was on the pulpit – and climbed up to him, and said: 'Descend from the pulpit of my father and go to the pulpit of your father.'" Umar replied: "My father had no pulpit"; and he took me and seated me with him. So, I began to toss pebbles in my hand, and when he descended, he took me to his home and said: "Who taught you?!" I replied: "By Allah, no one taught me" [He said: "O son! If only you would visit us"] (144).

footnote.p: 3- الزیادة من المصدر .
(144) The addition is from the source.

para.p: قال: «فأتیت یوماً – وهو خال بمعاویة – وابن عمر بالباب، فرجع ابن عمر ورجعت معه، فلقینی بعد وقال: لم أرک؟ فقلت: جئت وأنت خال بمعاویة، وابن عمر بالباب، فرجع ابن عمر ورجعت معه».

He said: "One day I went to him – while he was with Mu'awiya – and Ibn Umar was at the door, so Ibn Umar returned, and I returned with him. He encountered me later and said: "I did not see you?" I replied: "I came, and you were alone with Mu'awiya, and Ibn Umar at the door." So, Ibn Umar returned, and I returned with him."
«فقال: أنت أحق بالإذن من ابن عمر ; وإنّما أنبت ما تری فی رؤوسنا الله و (145) أنتم (146)» (147).
He said: "You are more deserving of permission than Ibn Umar; what you see in our heads has only been granted by Allah and (145) you (146)" (147).

footnote.p: 1- فی المصدر : ( ثم ) .
(145) In the source: (then).
2- [ الف و ب ] ف [ فایده : ] قول عمر به مخاطبه حضرت امام حسین ( علیه السلام ) : إنّما أنبت ماتری فی رؤوسنا الله ، ثم أنتم ، وفی روایة : أبوک . ( 12 ) .

(146) [A and B] and [Fayda]: Umar's statement to Imam Husain (peace be upon him) is: "What you see in our heads has only been caused by Allah, then you," and in another narration: "your father." (12).
3- تهذیب الکمال 6 / 404 .
(147) Tahdhib al-Kamal 6 / 404.

para.p: و در “ کنزالعمال “ مذکور است :
And it is mentioned in "Kanz al-Ummal":

عن حسین بن علی (علیهما السلام) قال: «صعدت إلی عمر [بن] (148) الخطاب المنبر، فقلت له: «انزل عن منبر أبی واصعد منبر أبیک». فقال: إن أبی لم یکن له منبر، فأقعدنی معه، فلمّا نزل ذهب [بی] (149) إلی منزله، فقال: أی بنی! من علّمک هذا؟ فقال: ما علّمنیه أحد، قال: أی بنی! لو جعلت تأتینا وتغشّانا ; [قال:] (150) «فجئت یوماً – وهو خال بمعاویة – وابن عمر بالباب لم یؤذن له، فرجعت، فلقینی بعد فقال: یا بنی! لم أرک أتیتنا، قلت: «جئت وأنت خال بمعاویة، فرأیت ابن عمر [رجع] (151)، فرجعت»، فقال: أنت أحق بالإذن من عبد الله بن عمر ; إنّما أنبت فی رؤوسنا ما تری، الله، ثم أنتم. . . فوضع یده علی رأسه»

From Husain ibn Ali (peace be upon them) who said: "I climbed to Umar [ibn] (148) al-Khattab's pulpit and said to him: 'Descend from my father's pulpit and ascend to your father's pulpit.'" He replied: "My father did not have a pulpit, so he seated me with him. When he descended, he went [with me] (149) to his home and said: 'O son! Who taught you this?' I said: 'No one taught me.' He said: 'O son! If you made it a point to come to us and be in our company.' [He said] (150) 'So one day I came – and he was alone with Mu'awiya – and Ibn Umar was at the door, not being given permission to enter. I returned, and he met me later and said: "O son! Did I not see you come to us?" I replied: "I came, and you were alone with Muawiyah, then you saw Ibn Umar [return] (151), so you returned," he said: "You are more deserving of permission than Abdullah ibn Umar; what you see is only what Allah, and then you, have caused to grow in our minds..." And he placed his hand on his head."

footnote.p: 4- الزیادة من المصدر .
(148) The addition is from the source.
5- الزیادة من المصدر .
(149) The addition is from the source.

para.p: . ابن سعد، وابن راهویه خط. (152) .
Ibn Sa'd and Ibn Rahwayh wrote this. (152)

footnote.p: 2- [ ب ] [ کنز العمال ] 7 / 105 . [ کنزالعمال 13 / 654 - 655 ( طبع مؤسسة الرسالة ، بیروت ) ] .
(152) [B] [Kanz al-Ummal] 7/105. [Kanz al-Ummal 13/654-655 (printed by Al-Ma'rifah Foundation, Beirut).

para.p: و ولی الله پدر مخاطب در “ ازالة الخفا “ آورده :
And Waliyullah, the father of the addressee, mentioned in "Izaalat al-Khafa":

عن الحسین بن علی بن أبی طالب – رضی الله عنهما – [علیهما السلام) قال: «أتیت عمر بن الخطاب – وهو علی المنبر – فصعدت إلیه فقلت له: «انزل عن منبر أبی واذهب إلی منبر أبیک» ; فقال عمر : لم یکن لأبی منبر . . وأخذنی فأجلسنی معه، فجعلت أُقلّب حصا بیدی، فلمّا نزل، انطلق بی إلی منزله: فقال لی: من علّمک؟ فقلت: «والله ما علّمنی أحد» ; فقال: یا بنی! لو جعلت تغشّانا ; قال: فأتیته یوماً – وهو خال بمعاویة – وابن عمر بالباب، فرجع ابن عمر فرجعت معه، فلقینی بعد فقال: لم أرک ; فقلت: «یا أمیر المؤمنین! إنی جئت وأنت خال بمعاویة وابن عمر بالباب، فرجع ابن عمر فرجعت معه» ; قال: أنت أحق بالإذن من ابن عمر ; إنّما أنبت ما فی رؤوسنا الله عزّ وجلّ ثم أنتم». (153) انتهی.

From al-Husain ibn Ali ibn Abi Talib – may Allah be pleased with them – (peace be upon them) who said: "I came to Umar ibn al-Khattab – while he was on the pulpit – and climbed up to him and said: 'Descend from my father's pulpit and go to your father's pulpit.'" Umar replied: "My father did not have a pulpit..." And he took me and seated me with him. I began to gather pebbles in my hand, and when he descended, he went with me to his home. He said to me: "Who taught you?" I replied: "By Allah, no one taught me." He said: "O my son! I wish you would visit us." So, I went to him one day – while he was alone with Muawiyah – and Ibn Umar was at the door. Ibn Umar returned, so I returned with him. He met me later and said: "I did not see you." I said: "O Commander of the Faithful! I came when you were alone with Muawiyah and Ibn Umar was at the door. Ibn Umar returned, so I returned with him." He said: "You are more deserving of permission than Ibn Umar; what is in our minds is only what Allah, the Exalted, and then you have caused to grow." (153) End.

footnote.p: 3- [ الف ] فضائل عمر و ذکر رعایت او صله اقارب آن حضرت را . [ ب ] ازالة الخفاء اردو 2 / 135 ( طبع کراچی ) . [ ازالة الخفاء 2 / 80 ] .
(153) [A] The virtues of Umar and mention of his care in maintaining the ties of his relatives. [b] Izaalat al-Khafa Urdu 2/135 (printed in Karachi). [Izaalat al-Khafa 2/80].

para.p: و ابن حجر ‹ 23 › در “ صواعق محرقه “ بعد ذکر قصه حضرت امام حسن ( علیه السلام ) با ابی بکر گفته :
And Ibn Hajar <23> in "Sawa'iq Muhriqah" after mentioning the story of Imam al-Hasan (peace be upon him) with Abu Bakr, said:
ووقع للحسین (علیه السلام) مثل ذلک مع عمر وهو علی المنبر فقال له: منبر أبیک – والله – لا منبر أبی ; فقال علی ; «والله ما أمرت بذلک». فقال عمر: والله ما اتهمناک.

And a similar incident occurred for al-Husain (peace be upon him) with Umar while he was on the pulpit, and he said to him: "The pulpit of your father – by God – is not the pulpit of my father"; to which ʿAli replied, "By God, I did not command to do that." ʿUmar said, "By God, we did not suspect you."
وزاد ابن سعد: إنه أخذه وأقعده إلی جنبه، وقال: هل أنبت الشعر علی رؤوسنا إلاّ أبوک . . أی إنّا الرفعة مانلناها إلا به. (154) انتهی.

Ibn Saʿd added: He took him and seated him next to him, and said: "Has anyone made hair grow on our heads except your father?" ... meaning that we have not attained this honor except through him. (154) End.

footnote.p: 1- [ ب ] صواعق محرقه : 175 ( طبع مصر 1375 ) . [ الصواعق المحرقة 2 / 515 ] .
(154) [B] Sawaa'iq Muhriqah: 175 (Cairo edition 1375). [al-Sawaa'iq al-Muhriqah 2 / 515].

para.p: و در این روایات - علاوه بر ما سبق - اعتراف عمر به کمال افضلیت جناب امیر ( علیه السلام ) و دیگر اهل بیت ( علیهم السلام ) بر او نیز مذکور است ، و آن هم دلیل واضح است بر بطلان خلافت او و خلافت ابی بکر .

And in these narrations – in addition to what has been mentioned previously – ʿUmar's acknowledgment of the complete superiority of His Excellency, the Commander of the Faithful (peace be upon him), and other members of the Prophet's Household (peace be upon them all) over him is also noted, and this is a clear evidence of the nullification of his caliphate and that of Abu Bakr.

title.p: طعن دوم : ترک قصاص خالد بن ولید در قتل مالک
Second Criticism: The failure in seeking legal retribution (qisas) from Khalid ibn al-Walid for the killing of Malik.

para.p: Dehalvi’s claim
قال : طعن دوم :
He said: Second Criticism:

آنکه مالک بن نویره زنی جمیله داشت ، خالد بن ولید که امیرالامرای ابوبکر بود ، به طمع ازدواجش ، مالک را که مرد مسلمان بود بکشت ، و همان شب زن او را به حباله نکاح در آورده ، مجامعت کرد ، و تا زمان انقضای عده وفات که چهار ماه و ده روز است توقف نکرد ، حال آنکه زنا واقع شد ; زیرا که نکاح در اثنای عده درست نیست ، و ابوبکر صدیق نه بر خالد حد زنا زد ، و نه از وی قصاص گرفت ; و حال آنکه استیفای قصاص و اجرای حد بر ابی بکر واجب بود ، و عمر در این کار بر وی انکار نمود ، و به خالد گفت که اگر من والی این امر میشوم از تو قصاص میگیرم (1) .

That Malik ibn Nuwayrah had a beautiful wife, Khalid ibn al-Walid, who was the commander of the army under Abu Bakr, killed Malik, who was a Muslim man, in the hope of marrying her. That very night, he took his wife into the bond of marriage and consummated it, and he did not wait until the end of the mourning period of four months and ten days, even though this was considered adultery; for marriage) is not valid during the mourning period. And Abu Bakr al-Siddiq did not impose a punishment for adultery on Khalid, nor did he seek retribution (qisas) for the murder from him; whereas it was obligatory for Abu Bakr to enforce retribution and carry out a punishment. And Umar objected to him in this matter, saying to Khalid that if he had overseen this matter, he would take retribution (qisas) from him (155).

footnote.p: 1- [ الف ] در مرافض الروافض مذکور است : طعن هفتم : مالک بن نویره زنی جمیله داشت ، خالد به طمع ازدواجش مالک را - که مردی مسلمان بود - بکشت و همان شب زن او را به حباله نکاح در آورده مجامعت کرد ، و تا زمان انقضای عده وفات زوج که به مقتضای کریمه : ( وَالَّذینَ یُتَوَفَّوْنَ مِنْکُمْ وَیَذَرُونَ أَزْواجاً یَتَرَبَّصْنَ بِأَنْفُسِهِنَّ أَرْبَعَةَ أَشْهُر وَعَشْراً فَإِذا بَلَغْنَ أَجَلَهُنَّ فَلا جُناحَ عَلَیْکُمْ فیما فَعَلْنَ فی أَنْفُسِهِنَّ بِالْمَعْرُوفِ وَاللّهُ بِما تَعْمَلُونَ خَبیرٌ ) . [ سورة البقرة ( 2 ) : 234 ] چهار ماه و ده روز است و نکاح در آن درست نیست ، توقف نکرد . و ابوبکر صدیق بر خالد نه حد زنا که به سبب مباشرت - مع عدم صحت مناکحت - لازم آمده بود جاری کرد ، و نه از وی قصاص گرفت ، و حال آنکه استیفای قصاص و اجرای حد بر ابوبکر واجب بود ، و عمر از این کار بر وی انکار کرد ، و به خالد گفت : اگر من والی این امر میشوم ، از تو قصاص میگیرم . ( 12 ) . [ مرافض الروافض : لم نعلم بطبعه ، ولا نعرف له نسخة فعلا ، نقل عنه الشیخ الأمینی فی الغدیر 1 / 142 فقال : حسام الدین بن محمد با یزید السهارنپوری ، صاحب مرافض الروافض ] .

(155) [A] It is mentioned in Maratid al-Rawafid: Seventh Reproach: Malik ibn Nuwayrah had a beautiful wife, Khalid killed Malik - who was a Muslim man - in the hope of marrying her and that very night took his wife into the bond of marriage and consummated it. He did not stop until the end of the mourning period of her deceased husband, which, by the implication of the verse: (And those of you who die and leave wives behind, they [the wives] shall wait for four months and ten days) [Surah al-Baqarah (2): 234], is four months and ten days, and marriage during this time is not valid. And Abu Bakr al-Siddiq did not enforce a punishment for adultery (zina) on Khalid, which was necessary due to the direct involvement - despite the invalidity of the marriage - nor did he seek retribution from him, even though it was obligatory for Abu Bakr to enforce retribution and carry out a punishment. And Umar objected to him in this matter, saying to Khalid: If I become the guardian (wali) of this affair, I will seek retribution from you. (12). [Maratid al-Rawafid: We are not aware of its printing, nor do we currently know of a copy. Shaikh al-Amini mentioned it in al-Ghadir 1/142, saying: Husam al-Din ibn Muhammad with Yazid al-Saharnapuri, the author of Maratid al-Rawafid].

para.p: جواب این طعن موقوف بر بیان این قصه است ، موافق آنچه در کتب معتبره فن سیر و تواریخ ثابت است ، باید دانست که : خالد بعد فراغ از مهم طلیحة بن خویلد اسدی مُتنبّی که به اغوای شیطانی این دعوی باطل آغاز نهاده بود ، به نواحی بطاح توجه نمود ، وسرایا به اطراف و جوانب فرستاد ، و بر طریقه مسنونه جناب پیغمبر صلی الله علیه [ وآله ] وسلّم فرمود تا بر سر قومی که بتازند ، اگر آواز (1) اذان در آن قوم بشنوند ، دست از غارت و قتل و نهب باز دارند ، و اگر آواز اذان به گوش ایشان نرسد ، آن مقام را دارالحرب قرار داده ، دستِ قتل و غارت بگشایند ، و دود از دمار آن قوم برآرند .

The answer to this objection depends on recounting this story. According to what is established in the reliable books of the study of expeditions and histories, it must be understood that: Khalid, after completing the matter of Talha ibn Khuwailid al-Asadi, the self-proclaimed Prophet, who had begun this false claim under satanic delusion, turned his attention to the regions of Betaah. He sent detachments to the surrounding areas and, following the customary practice of the Prophet (peace be upon him [and his holy progeny]), instructed them to act as follows: they were to confront a people with hostilities, and if they heard the call (156) of prayers (azaan) among that people, they should refrain from plunder, killing, and looting. However, if no sound of prayers (azaan) reached their ears, they were to consider that place a house of war (daar al-harb) and could unleash the hand of killing and plundering, raising smoke from the remnants of that people.

footnote.p: 1- در [ الف ] به جای : ( آواز ) اشتباهاً : ( او ) نوشته شده است .
(156) In [A], instead of: (call), it was mistakenly written: (he).

para.p: اتفاقاً سریه [ ای ] که ابوقتاده انصاری نیز در میانشان بود ، مالک بن نویره را - که به امر آن حضرت صلی الله علیه [ وآله ] وسلّم ریاست بطاح ، و خدمت اخذ صدقات سکان آن نواح (1) به وی تعلق داشت - گرفته پیش خالد آوردند ، ابوقتاده گواهی داد که من بانگ نماز از میان قوم وی شنیده ام ، و جماعت دیگر - که هم در آن سریه بودند - عکس آن ظاهر نمودند .

Coincidentally, in the expedition [i.e.,] in which Abu Qatadah Ansari was also present, they captured Malik bin Nuwayrah – who, by the command of the Prophet (peace be upon him [and his holy family]), was appointed as the chief of Betaah and was responsible for collecting alms from the inhabitants of those regions (157) – and brought him before Khalid. Abu Qatadah testified that he had heard the call to prayer (azaan) from among his people, while the other members of the expedition contradicted that claim.

footnote.p: 1- نواح ، مأخوذ از تازی است ، به معنای نواحی و حوالی و محال . رجوع شود به لغت نامه دهخدا .
(157) "Regions" (nawahi) is derived from Arabic, meaning areas, vicinity, and places. Refer to Dehkhoda Dictionary.

para.p: و اینقدر خود به شهادت مردم گرد و نواح به ثبوت رسیده بود که هنگام استماع خبر قیامت اثر وفات جناب پیغمبر صلی الله علیه [ وآله ] وسلّم ، زنان خانه این مالک بن نویره حنابندی و دف نوازی ، و دیگر لوازم فرحت و شادی به عمل آورده ، شماتت به اهل اسلام نموده بودند .

What was established through testimony of local people was that upon hearing the news of the Prophet’s (peace be upon him and his family) death, the women of Malik’s household began beating tambourines, singing, and performing acts of joy and celebration, mocking the Muslims.

اتفاقاً مالک به حضور خالد در مقام سؤال و جواب در حق جناب پیغمبر صلی الله علیه [ وآله ] وسلّم این کلمه گفت : ( قال رجلکم . . کذا ; أو صاحبکم ) . و این اضافه به سوی اهل اسلام ، نه به خود ، شیوه کفار ‹ 24 › و مرتدان آن زمان بود .

In Khalid’s presence, during questioning about the Prophet (peace be upon him [and his holy progeny]), Malik made a statement such as, “Your man said such and such” or “Your companion said such and such.” Referring to the Prophet this way — as “your man” instead of “our Prophet” — was the style of the disbelievers and apostates of that time.

و سابق این هم منقح شده بود که بعد استماع خبر وحشت اثر وفات پیغمبر صلی الله علیه [ وآله ] وسلّم ، مالک بن نویره صدقاتی که از قوم خود گرفته بود بر آنها ردّ نمود ، و گفت : باری از مؤونه این شخص خلاص شدید .

It was also confirmed earlier that after hearing the disturbing news of the Prophet’s (peace be upon him [and his holy progeny]) death, Malik returned the sadaqat he had collected to his tribe and said, “You are now free from the burden of that man.”
باز به حضور خالد این ادای ارتداد از وی صادر شد ، خالد حکم فرمود که او را به قتل رسانند .
Again, in Khalid’s presence, this act of apostasy was confirmed by him, so Khalid ordered that he be executed.
چون این خبر به مدینه منوره رسید ، و از این حرکت خالد ، ابوقتاده انصاری بر آشفته نیز به دارالخلافه آمد ، و خالد را تخطئه نمود .
When this news reached Medina al-Munawwarah, and Abu Qatadah Ansari became enraged by Khalid’s actions, he came to the capital (Dar al-Khilafah) and criticized Khalid.

عمر بن الخطاب در اول وهله همین دانست که این قتل بی جا واقع شد ، و بر خالد قصاص و حد میآید ; چون ابوبکر صدیق خالد را به حضور خود طلبید ، و از وی استفسار حال نمود ، ماجرا من و عن ظاهر شد ، و حق به جانب خالد دریافته متعرض حال او نشد ، و او را باز به منصب امیرالامرائی به حال فرمود .

Umar bin al-Khattab at first glance considered this killing unjustified and believed retribution (qisas) and the legal punishment (hadd) applied to Khalid. When Abu Bakr al-Siddiq summoned Khalid and inquired about the matter from him, the incident became fully clear, and he found that the truth was on Khalid’s side. He did not take any action against him and reinstated him to his position as commander-in-chief.
حالا در این قصه تأمل باید کرد ، و حکم فقهی این صورت را باید فهمید که قصاص چه قسم بر خالد لازم میآید ؟ و حد زنا چرا بر وی واجب میشود ؟

Now, this story requires careful consideration, and the legal ruling of this case must be understood: How does retribution (qisas) become applicable to Khalid? And why would the punishment (hadd) for adultery (zina) become obligatory on him?
آمدیم بر اینکه استبرا به یک حیض ، زن حربی را هم ضرور است ، و خالد انتظار این مدت هم نکشید .
We acknowledge that even for a woman from a land at war, a waiting period of one menstrual cycle is required, and Khalid did not wait for this period.
پس جوابش آنکه : این طعن بر خالد است نه بر ابی بکر ، و خالد معصوم نبود ، و نه امام عام .
Thus, the answer is that this ctricism is against Khalid, not against Abu Bakr, and Khalid was not infallible, nor was he the general leader (Imam) of the Muslim Ummah.
و مع هذا این روایت که خالد همان شب با آن زن صحبت داشت ، در هیچ کتاب معتبر نیست .
Moreover, the narration that Khalid had intercourse with the woman on the same night is not found in any reliable book.

و اگر در بعض کتب غیر معتبره یافته میشود ، جواب آن نیز همراه این روایت موجود است که : این زن را مالک از مدتی مطلقه ساخته ، محبوس داشته بود بنابر رسم جاهلیت ، و برای دفع همین رسم فاسد ایشان این آیه نازل شد : ( وَإِذا طَلَّقْتُمُ النِّساءَ فَبَلَغْنَ أَجَلَهُنَّ فَلا تَعْضُلُوهُنَّ ) (1) ، پس عده (2) او منقضی شده بود ، و نکاح او حلال گشته ، به همین جهت خالد انتظار عده دیگر نکشید ، همین است مذهب جمیع فقهای اهل سنت ، و چون در این باب الزام اهل سنت ، و اثبات مطاعن به روایات و مذاهب ایشان منظور است ، لابد ملاحظه روایات و مسائل ایشان باید کرد ، و الا مقصود حاصل نخواهد شد ، فی الاستیعاب :

And if this is found in some unreliable books, the answer is also present alongside that narration, which is: This woman had been divorced by Malik some time earlier, and he had kept her confined according to the custom of the Age of Ignorance (Jahiliyya). And to abolish this corrupt practice, this verse was revealed: (And when you divorce the women and they reach their appointed term, do not prevent them [from remarrying]) (158), then her waiting period (159) had ended, and her marriage had become lawful, for this reason Khalid did not wait for another waiting period. This is the belief of all the scholars of the Ahle Tasannun. Since the intention in this matter is to impose upon Ahle Tasannun and to establish criticisms through their narrations and opinions, it is necessary to consider their narrations and issues; otherwise, the goal will not be achieved. In al-Isti'ab:

footnote.p: 1- سورة البقرة ( 2 ) : 232 .
(158) Surah al-Baqarah (2): 232.
2- در [ الف ] اشتباهاً : ( وعده ) آمده است .
(159) In [A] it was mistakenly written as (and the waiting period).

para.p: وأمره – أی خالداً – أبو بکر الصدیق علی الجیوش ففتح الله علیه الیمامة وغیرها ; و قتل علی یدیه أکثر أهل الردة، منهم: مسیلمة (160)، و مالک بن نویرة . . . (161) إلی آخر ما قال.

And Abu Bakr al-Siddiq appointed him – meaning Khalid – over the armies, and Allah opened al-Yamamah and other places to him; and through his hands, most of the people of apostasy were killed, including: Musaylimah (160), and Malik ibn Nuwayrah... (161) to the end of what he said.

footnote.p: 3- در [ الف ] اشتباهاً : ( المسیلمة ) آمده است ، ولی در تحفه و استیعاب بدون الف و لام ثبت شده است .
(160) In [A] it was mistakenly written as (the Musaylimah), but in Tuhfah and al-Isti'ab recorded without the definite article.
4- الاستیعاب 2 / 429 .

para.p: جواب دیگر : سلّمنا که مالک بن نویره مرتد نبود ، اما شبهه ارتداد او بلاریب در ذهن خالد جا گرفته بود ، والقصاص یندرئ بالشبهات ; و چه میفرمایند علمای دین و مفتیان شرع مبین از امامیه و اهل سنت : در صورتی که اگر از شخصی این حرکات و این کلمات که از مالک بن نویره سر بر زد ، واقع شود ، یا روز عاشورا فرحت و شادی ، و کلمات اهانتِ حضرت امام ( علیه السلام ) و تحقیر جناب ایشان و دیگر خاندان رسول صلی الله علیه [ وآله ] وسلّم و اولاد بتول ( علیها السلام ) که در آن روز به مصیبت گرفتار شده بودند از وی صدور یابد ; او را چه باید کرد ؟

Another response: Even if we accept that Malik bin Nuwayrah was not an apostate, there is no doubt that suspicion of apostasy had clearly formed in Khalid’s mind. And qisas (retribution) is dropped in cases of doubt. Now, what do the scholars of religion and jurists of Islamic law, both from the Imamiyyah and the Ahle Tasannun, say: If someone shows the same actions and words as those that appeared from Malik bin Nuwayrah — for example, on the Day of Ashura, he expresses joy and happiness, utters words of insult toward the Imam (peace be upon him), and belittles him and the family of the Messenger (peace be upon him and his holy family) and the children of Fatimah (peace be upon her) who were afflicted with tragedy that day — what should be done with such a person?
اگر حکم به ارتداد او نمایند ، فبها ; و الا اگر شخصی این حرکات و این کلمات را دریافته او را به قتل رساند ، به گمان آنکه مرتد شد ، قصاص بر وی میآید یا نه ؟
If they judge him as an apostate, then so be it. But if someone witnesses these actions and statements and kills him, thinking he had become an apostate — would qisas apply to him or not?

جواب ‹ 25 › دیگر : ابوبکر صدیق خلیفه رسول صلی الله علیه [ وآله ] وسلّم بود ، نه خلیفه شیعه و سنی ، او را به فرمایش و خواهش ایشان کار کردن نمیرسد ، بلکه موافق سنت پیغمبر صلی الله علیه [ وآله ] وسلّم بایستی کرد ، و در حضور جناب پیغمبر صلی الله علیه [ وآله ] وسلّم همین خالد بن الولید صدها را از مسلمانان ، مفت به شبهه ارتداد کشته بود ، و آن حضرت اصلا متعرض نشده [ بود ] ، چنانچه به اجماع اهل سیر و تواریخ ثابت است .

Another response <26>: Abu Bakr al-Siddiq was the Caliph of the Messenger (peace be upon him and his holy progeny), not the Caliph of Shiites or (so called) Sunnis. He was not supposed to act according to their opinions or desires, but rather according to the Sunnah of the Prophet (peace be upon him [and his holy family]). And in the lifetime of the Prophet (peace be upon him [and his holy family]), this very Khalid bin Walid had killed many Muslims under suspicion of apostasy, and the Prophet never held him accountable for it — as is established by consensus among historians and scholars of history and biographies.

قصه اش آنکه : جناب پیغمبر صلی الله علیه [ وآله ] وسلّم خالد را بر لشکری امیر کرده فرستاده بودند ، و او بر قومی تاخت و آنها اسلام آورده بودند ، لیکن هنوز قواعد اسلام را درست ندانسته ، در وقتی که مشغول به قتل آنها شدند ، در مقام اظهار اسلام این کلمه از زبانشان برآمد که ( صبأنا صبأنا ) (1) یعنی بی دین شدیم ، بی دین شدیم ، مراد آنکه از دین قدیم خود توبه کردیم و به اسلام در آمدیم . خالد به کشتن همه آنها امر فرمود ، عبدالله بن عمر - که یکی از متعینان خالد بود - یاران و رفیقان خود را تقید کرد که این مردم را اسیر دارید و نکشید ، چون به حضور جناب حضرت پیغمبر صلی الله علیه [ وآله ] وسلّم رسیدند و آن ماجرا اظهار کردند ، جناب پیغمبر ( صلی الله علیه وآله ) بر آشفت و بسیار افسوس کرد ، و گفت : « اللهم إنی أبرء الیک ممّا صنع خالد » . و بر خالد قصاص جاری نفرمود ، و نه از او دیه دهانید ; زیرا که شبهه کفر به خاطرش افتاد .

The story is as follows: The noble Prophet (peace be upon him and his holy family) had appointed Khalid as the commander over an army and sent him forth. He attacked a group of people who had embraced Islam, but they had not yet properly learned the rules of Islam. While they were being attacked and killed, they uttered the phrase (Saba’naa, Saba’naa) (162), meaning “We have left our former religion,” intending to say they had repented from their old faith and entered into Islam. Khalid gave the order to kill all of them. Abdullah ibn Umar — who was among Khalid’s prominent companions — restrained his companions and instructed them to capture those people and not kill them. When they reached the presence of the noble Prophet (peace be upon him and his holy family) and reported the incident, the Prophet (peace be upon him and his holy family) was angered and deeply grieved, and he said: "O Allah, I disassociate myself before You from what Khalid has done." However, the Prophet (peace be upon him and his holy family) did not impose legal retribution (qisas) upon Khalid, nor did he demand blood money (diyah) from him, because the suspicion of disbelief had occurred in his mind.

footnote.p: 1- در [ الف ] اشتباهاً : ( صیانا صیانا ) آمده است . قال ابن الأثیر : فی حدیث بنی جذیمة : کانوا یقولون - لمّا أسلموا - : ( صبأنا صبأنا ) ، قد تکرّرت هذه اللفظة فی الحدیث ، یقال : صبأ فلان ، إذا خرج من دین إلی دین غیره . انظر : النهایة 3 / 3 .

(162) In [A] it erroneously states: (Siyanaa, Siyanaa). Ibn al-Athir said: In the narration of Banu Judhaymah: they were saying - when they embraced Islam - (Sab'aanaa, Sab'aanaa); this term is repeated in the narration. It is said: (Saba fulaan), if someone leaves one religion for another. See: al-Nihayah 3 / 3.

para.p: پس اگر ابوبکر صدیق نیز بابت خون یک کس ، به مثل این شبهه ، بلکه قوی تر از آن با خالد تعرض ننماید ، چه بدی کرده باشد ، علی الخصوص ابوبکر که (1) دیه مالک هم از بیت المال دهانید (2) .

So if Abu Bakr as-Siddiq also did not confront Khalid regarding the blood of a single person, due to a similar suspicion, or even a stronger one, then what wrong had he done, especially since Abu Bakr (163) also paid the blood money for Malik from the public treasury (Bayt al-Mal) (164).

footnote.p: 1- در مصدر : ( که ابوبکر ) .
(163) In the source: (that Abu Bakr).

2- [ الف و ب ] در “ قرة العینین “ مذکور است : از آن جمله آن است که : صدیق از استیفای قصاص مالک بن نویره توقف کرد ، باید دانست که اهل تاریخ در [ این ] قصه مختلف اند : جمعی نقل کرده اند که : مالک بن نویره مرتد شده بود ; و جمعی نقل کرده اند که مرتد نبود ، اما خالد بعضِ کلمات از وی شنیده بود و حکم به کفر او کرد ، بالجمله ; در درء قصاص از خالد اتفاق دارند ، از جهت ارتداد یا از جهت شبهه ارتداد . وفی الاستیعاب [ 2 / 429 ] : وأمّره - أی خالداً - أبو بکر الصدیق علی الجیوش ، ففتح الله علیه الیمامة و غیرها ، و قتل علی یدیه أکثر أهل الردّة ، منهم مسیلمة و مالک بن نویرة ، وقد اختلف فی حال مالک بن نویرة ، فقیل : إنه قُتل [ قتله ] مسلماً ، لظنّ ظنّه به و کلام سمعه منه ، وأنکر علیه [ أبو ] قتادة قتله ، و خالفه فی ذلک ، وأقسم أن لا یقاتل تحت رأیته ابدأ . وقیل : قُتل [ بل قتله ] کافراً . وخبره بذلک یطول ذکره . انتهی . بالجمله ; حضرت صدیق را در دَرء قصاص از خالد ، اسوه حسنه است به رسول الله صلی الله علیه [ وآله ] وسلّم در قصه صیانا . . صیانا [ صبأنا . . صبأنا ] . و این مسأله اجتهادیه [ ای ] است که علما در آن مختلف شدند ، و صدیق به حسب اجتهاد خود کار فرمود ، و همچنین است وظیفه خلیفه چون به اجتهاد فقهای دیگر مخالف شده . ( 12 ) . [ قرة العینین : 186 - 187 ]

(164) [A and B] mentioned in "Qurat al-'Aynayn": Among them is that as-Siddiq refrained from exacting retribution (qisas) for the blood of Malik ibn Nuwayra, it must be understood that historians differ regarding this story: Some narrate that Malik ibn Nuwayra had become an apostate (murtad); and others narrate that he had not become an apostate, but Khalid had heard some words from him and judged him to be an unbeliever (kafir). In any case, they agree on ascribing the absence of retribution (dar' qisas) from Khalid, whether due to apostasy (irtidad) or the semblance of apostasy. And in al-Isti'ab [2 / 429]: And Abu Bakr as-Siddiq appointed him - that is, Khalid - over the armies, and Allah opened al-Yamamah and other places to him, and through his hands, most of the people of apostasy (ahl ar-ridda) were killed, including Musaylima and Malik ibn Nuwayra. There has been disagreement regarding the situation of Malik ibn Nuwayra; it is said that he was killed [by them] as a Muslim, due to a suspicion he had and words he heard from him, and [Abu] Qatadah rebuked him for killing him and opposed him in this, swearing that he would never fight under his banner again. It is also said that he was killed [rather, he killed him] as a disbeliever (kafir). The details of this matter would be lengthy to mention. End of quote. In short, the Siddiq has set a good example in the prevention of retribution (dar' qisas) from Khalid, akin to the Messenger of Allah, peace be upon him and his holy progeny, in the story of the prevention (Siyana) . . Prevention (Siyana) [of those who had become non-religious (Sabbana) . . Sabbana]. And this issue is one of ijtihad that scholars have differed on, and as-Siddiq acted according to his ijtihad, and this is how the duty of a caliph is when it opposes the ijtihad of other scholars. (12). [Qurat al-'Aynayn: 186-187]

para.p: جواب دیگر : اگر توقف ابوبکر در استیفای قصاص مالک بن نویره قادح در خلافت او باشد ، توقف حضرت امیر ( علیه السلام ) در استیفای قصاص عثمان به طریق اولی قادح باشد ; زیرا که هیچ موجب قتل در او نه متحقق بود و نه متوهم .

Another response: If Abu Bakr's delay in enforcing the retribution (qisas) for Malik ibn Nuwaira is considered a flaw in his caliphate, then the Commander of the Faithful (Amir al-Momineen), (peace be upon him), delay in enforcing the qisas for Uthman would be an even greater flaw; because there was neither a substantial reason for his (Uthman's) death nor an apparent one.
پس اهل سنت چون این را قادح نمیدانند ، او را چرا قادح خواهند دانست ؟ ! پس بر ایشان الزام عاید نمیشود (1) .
Therefore, since the Ahle Tasannun do not regard this as a flaw, why would they consider it a flaw in him (Abu Bakr)?! Thus, no obligation arises upon them (165).

footnote.p: 1- [ الف ] و اگر این توقف قادح باشد در صدیق ، توقف حضرت مرتضی [ ( علیه السلام ) ] از استیفای قصاص حضرت ذی النورین به طریق اولی قادح باشد ; زیرا که هیچ موجب قتل ذی النورین متحقق نبود و نه متوهم ، فما هو جوابکم هناک هو بعینه جوابنا هنا . ( 12 ) . [ قرة العینین : 187 ] .

(165) [A] And if this pause is a flaw in the Truthful One (Siddiq), then the Commander of the Chosen One (Murtadá), peace be upon him, and his holy progeny’s, pause in enforcing the qisas for the One with Two Lights (Dhu al-Nurayn) would be an even greater flaw; because there was neither a substantial reason for the Dhu al-Nurayn's (Uthman's) death nor an apparent one, so your answer there would be precisely our answer here. (12). [Qurrat al-‘Aynayn: 187].

para.p: جواب دیگر : استیفای قصاص مالک بن نویره از خالد وقتی بر ذمه ابوبکر واجب میشد که ورثه مالک طلب قصاص میکردند ، و هرگز طلب ورثه او ثابت نشد ، بلکه برادر او متمم بن نویره نزد عمر بن الخطاب - با وصف عشقی و محبتی که با مالک داشت ، و طول العمر در فراق او ناله زنان و جامه دران ماند ، و مرثیه هایی که در حق او گفته است ، در عرب مشهور ، و ضرب المثل شده بود .

Another response: The retribution (qisas) from Khalid for the killing of Malik ibn Nuwayra would become obligatory upon Abu Bakr when Malik's heirs demanded it, and the demand of his heirs was never established. Rather, his brother, Munthir ibn Nuwayra, remained with Umar ibn al-Khattab – despite the love and affection he had for Malik, and he spent the remainder of his life lamenting in separation from him, in mourning attire, and the elegies he composed in Malik's honor became well-known and proverbial among the Arabs.
من جملتها هذان البیتان المشهوران :
Among these were the two famous couplets:
وکنا کندمانی جزیمة حقبة
We were like the tightly bound cords of Juzaymah,
من الدهر حتّی قیل لن یتصدّعا
For a long time, until it was said they would never part.
فلمّا تفرّقنا کأنّی ومالکا
But when we separated, it was as if I and Malik,
بطول اجتماع لیلة لم نبت معا
Despite our long companionship, had never spent a night together.
اعتراف به ارتداد او نموده (1) .
(acknowledging his apostasy (irtidad) (166)

footnote.p: 1- [ الف ] جواب : وجوب استیفای قصاص بر ابی بکر مسلم نیست تا به ترک آن مستحق طعن شده [ باشد ] ; زیرا که اخذ آن بر آن جناب وقتی واجب میگشت که ورثه مالک طلب قصاص میکردند ، و بعد از طلب قتل خالد ، او را بدون حجت شرعی - که مجوز قتل او بود - ثابت و محقق میشد . و یحتمل که ورثه مالک طلب قصاص نکرده باشند . و مؤید این معنا است آنچه در کتب صحاح نقل کرده اند که : برادر مالک نزد امیرالمؤمنین عمر به ارتداد مالک اعتراف کرد . . . تا آنکه گفته : و یحتمل که مباشرت نزد آن جناب ثابت نشده باشد ، و یا صحت مناکحت - به سبب آنکه عده اش به وضع حمل بعد موت مالک منقضی شده باشد ، و یا وی بعد از انقضای عدّه ، بر عادت جاهلیت ، نزد مالک محبوسه بود - نزد آن جناب ظاهر شده باشد . و تحقیق سخن در این مقام - بر نهجی که دافع طعن خالد ، و هم از آن امام بود بر وفق آنچه در روایات صحیحه و کتب معتبره آمده است - آن است که : خالد بعد از فراق از مهم طلحة بن خویلد که به اغوای شیطانی - بعد از رحلت محبوب ربانی سر به شورش و فساد برآورده - دعوی باطل نبوت کرده بود ، به نواحی بطاح رفت و سرایا به اطراف فرستاد ، چون طریقه [ پیامبر ] علیه [ وآله ] الصلاة والتحیة بود که هرگاه بر قومی میتاختند و بانگ نماز در آنها میشنودند ، غارت نمیبردند و قتل نمیفرمودند ، و اگر اذان نمیشنیدند تاراج میکردند و ته تیغ میکشیدند . . . تا آنکه گفته که : خالد مطابق سنت آن حضرت صلی الله علیه [ وآله ] و سلم به سرایا گفت : در هر قبیله که اذان بشنوید دست تعرض از آن کوتاه دارید ، و اگر نشنوید دود از دودمان آنها برآرید و سر ببرید . ابوقتاده انصاری - که میان ایشان بود - مالک را که به امر آن حضرت ریاست بطاح و خدمت اخذ صدقات سکان آنجا به وی تعلق داشت ، گرفته پیش خالد آوردند ، ابوقتاده گواهی داد که من بانگ نماز میان قوم وی شنیده ام ، جماعت دیگر که هم در آن سریه بودند عکس آن ظاهر نمودند ، مالک به سخن در آمد ، در اثنای تکلم گفت : ( قال رجلکم ) ; و به روایتی : ( صاحبکم هکذا ) ; و اشارت بدان حضرت کرد - علیه [ وآله ] الصلاة والتحیة - خالد از آن سخن برآشفته گفت که : ای سگ ! مگر آن حضرت صاحب و رجل تو نبودند ; وی را قتل نمود . . . تا آنکه گفته : و در بعضی روایات آمده که : چون در بطاح خبر وحشت افزای واقعه هوش ربای سرور انبیا ، سردفتر اصفیا - صلی الله علیه [ وآله ] کما یلیق بشأنه و یحری - به گوش مالک رسید حالش سر به ارتداد کشید ، صدقات که از آنجا گرفته بود همه را بر آنها ردّ نمود ، و خالد چون در بطاح آمد خبرهای وی [ را ] شنید ، و از بعضی امور و اداهای آن را معلوم کرده وی را به قتل رسانید ، تا آنکه گفته : . . . [ دنباله مطلب در تعلیقه آینده ] .
