(166) [A] Response: The obligation of retribution (qisas) upon Abu Bakr is not unquestionable, so that he would deserve criticism for neglecting it; because taking it upon himself would only become obligatory when Malik's heirs demanded retribution (qisas), and after the demand for Khalid's killing, it would be established and realized without a legal proof (hujjah), justifying his death. It is possible that Malik's heirs did not demand retribution. This is supported by what has been narrated in the books of authentic traditions (sahih), that Malik's brother confessed to Umar, the Commander of the Faithful (Amir al-Mu'minin), regarding Malik's apostasy (irtidad) . . . until it is said that the direct involvement (mubasharat) with that person was not established, or the validity of his marriage (mariage) - because his waiting period (iddah) may have ended with the birth that occurred after Malik's death, or he might have been, after the end of the waiting period, in a state of confinement (muhbasah) according to the customs of ignorance (jahiliyyah) with Malik - may have seemed apparent to that person.
The clarification of the matter in this regard - as a defense against the criticism of Khalid, and also from that Imam (Imam) in accordance with what has come in authentic narrations (riwayat sahih) and reputable books - is that Khalid, after parting from the significant matters of Talhah ibn Khuwailid, who, led by satanic temptation - after the departure of the Divinely Beloved - had risen in rebellion and corruption, falsely claimed Prophethood, went to the regions of Betah and sent expeditions to the surrounding areas. For it was the practice of the Prophet (peace be upon him and his holy progeny) that whenever they attacked a people and heard the call to prayer (azaan) among them, they would not take spoils or make killings. If they did not hear the adhan, they would plunder and draw swords . . . until it is said that Khalid, following the tradition (sunnah) of that Noble Prophet (peace be upon him and his holy progeny), said to the expeditions: "In every tribe where you hear the call to prayer (azaan), keep your hands from them, and if you do not hear it, raise smoke from their kin and behead them." Abu Qatadah al-Ansari, who was among them, brought Malik, who was appointed by that Prophet (prophet) to lead Betaah and to serve in the collection of alms (sadaqat) in that area, seized and brought him before Khalid. Abu Qatadah testified that he had heard the call to prayer (azaan) among his people, while others who were also in that expedition (sariyah) contradicted this. Malik began to speak, and in the midst of his speech, he said: “Your man said”; and according to another narration: “Your companion like this”; and he referred to that Noble Figure - (peace be upon him and his holy progeny) - Khalid, angered by this remark, said: "O dog! Was not that Noble One (peace be upon him and his holy progeny) your master and companion?" And he killed him... until it is said: And in some narrations, it is mentioned that when the news of the terrifying event, the mind-bewildering occurrence of the Master of Prophets (peace be upon him and his holy progeny), the chief scribe of the Pure Ones (Usfiya) (peace be upon him and his holy progeny), reached Malik in Betaah, his state turned to one of apostasy (irtidad), and he returned all the alms (sadaqat) he had collected from there to them. When Khalid came to Betaah, he heard news of him and learned of some matters and restitutions, and he had him killed... until it is said that... [the continuation of the matter will be in the next footnote].

para.p: و مِن بعد عمر بن الخطاب بر انکاری که در زمان ابوبکر صدیق داشت نادم شد ، و معترف گردید که هر چه صدیق به عمل آورد عین صواب و محض حق بود .
And after Umar ibn al-Khattab showed regret for the denial he had during the time of Abu Bakr al-Siddiq, and he acknowledged that whatever al-Siddiq did was entirely correct and absolute truth.

و دلیل واضح بر این ، آنکه : عمر بن الخطاب با وصف آن شدتی که در اجرای حدود و استیفای قصاص داشت ، در زمان خلافت خود و اقتدار زاید الوصف ، هرگز متعرض احوال خالد نشد ، نه حد زد و نه قصاص گرفت (1) (2) . ‹ 26 ›

A clear proof of this is that: Umar ibn al-Khattab, despite the intensity he had in enforcing penalties and exacting retribution, never interfered in the affairs of Khalid during his caliphate and indescribable authority, nor did he impose a penalty on him or seek retribution (167) (168). <26>

footnote.p: 1- تحفه اثناعشریه : 262 - 264 .
(167) Tuhfat al-Ithna'ashiriyyah: 262 - 264.

2- [ الف ] وأمّا إنکار عمر . . . فبعد التسلیم لا یدلّ علی قدحه فی إمامته ، بل هو من إنکار المجتهدین بعضهم علی بعض فیما یؤدّی فیه اجتهاده . . وهکذا کان شأن السلف ، ولا یرون ذلک نقصاً . و مع ذلک أمیرالمؤمنین [ ( علیه السلام ) ] نیز در ایام خلافت خویش متعرض احوال خالد نشده ، و نه او را حد زده ، و نه از او قصاص گرفته ، پس این عدم تعرض - با وجود قدرت - دلالت میکند که آخر [ الامر ] آن امیرالمؤمنین [ ( علیه السلام ) ] را حقیّت آنچه ابوبکر صدیق . . . کرده بود ، ظاهر شد و این انکار و اعتراض که طاعنان نقل کرده اند - بر تقدیر وجود - پیش از ظهور حقیت فعل آن جناب خواهد بود و الا آن امیرالمؤمنین [ ( علیه السلام ) ] که در اقامه قواعد دین و اجرای احکام شرع متین از [ یک کلمه خوانا نیست ] هیچ کس ملاحظه و اندیشه نداشت اصلا در اجرای حد و استیفای قصاص مداهنه نمیکرد و مساهله نمیفرمودند . ( 12 ) .

(168) [A] As for Umar's denial . . . after submission, it does not indicate a deficiency in his Imamate, but rather it is a denial of some among the Mujtahids towards each other in matters where their ijtihad might be expressed… And such was the situation of the predecessors, and they did not see it as a shortcoming. Nevertheless, the Commander of the Faithful (peace be upon him) also did not interfere in the affairs of Khalid during his own caliphate, nor did he impose a penalty on him, or seek retribution from him, so this lack of interference - despite the ability - indicates that ultimately [the matter] was made clear to the Commander of the Faithful (peace be upon him) regarding the truth of what Abu Bakr al-Siddiq . . . had done, and this denial and objection noted by the critics - even if it existed - would be before the truth of that noble act became apparent; otherwise, the Commander of the Faithful (peace be upon him) who was unwavering in establishing the foundations of religion and enforcing the laws of Shariah, showed no consideration or thought towards anyone at all in enforcing penalties and exacting retribution, nor would they practice leniency or make concessions. (12).

para.p: The response of the respected author
أقول :
I say:
ما اول به نقل اصل عبارت بعضی از علمای اعلامِ خودِ [ مان که ] متضمن تقریر این طعن [ است ] میپردازیم ، بعد از آن به دفع شبهات و نقض اقوال او متوجه میشویم .

Let us first address the beginning of the text (Naql) of the original statement of some of the distinguished scholars of our own [people] that contains a depiction of this objection, and then we will turn to refuting doubts and rebutting his statements.
پس بدان که صاحب کتاب “ الاستغاثه “ بعد [ از ] اتمام طعن اول از مطاعن ابی بکر - که متضمن اطلاق لفظ خلیفه رسول ( صلی الله علیه وآله ) بر خود است - گفته :

Know that the author of the book "Al-Istighathah" after completing the first objection from the criticisms of Abu Bakr – which includes the application of the title Caliph of the Messenger (peace be upon him and his holy progeny) upon himself – said:

فلمّا انقاد له الناس فیما وصفنا طوعا وکرها ، امتنعت علیه قبیلة من العرب فی دفع الزکاة إلیه ، وقالوا : إن الرسول ( صلی الله علیه وآله و سلم ) لم یأمرنا بدفع ذلک إلیک ، ولا أمرک بمطالبتنا به ، فعلی ما تطالبنا بما لم یأمر الله به ولا رسوله ؟ ! فسمّاهم : أهل الردّ ، وبعث (169) خالد بن الولید فی جیش فقتل مقاتلیهم ، وسبی ذراریهم ، واستباح أموالهم ، وجعل ذلک کلّه قسمة (170) بین المسلمین ، فقبلوا ذلک منه مستحلّین له إلاّ نفر کرهوا ذلک ، منهم عمر بن الخطاب فإنه عزل سهمه منهم ، وکان عنده إلی أن ملک الأمر ، ثم ردّه علیهم ، وکانت خولة بنت جعفر والدة محمد بن الحنفیة منهم ، فبعث بها إلی أمیر المؤمنین علی بن أبی طالب ( علیه السلام ) ، فتزوّجها ولم یستملکها (171) ، واستحلّ الباقون فزُوّج نساؤهم (172) ; وقتل خالد بن ولید رئیس القوم مالک بن نویرة ، وأخذ امرأته فوطئها من لیلته تلک من غیر أن استبرأها (173) ، ولا اشتراها (174) ، ولا وقعت علیها قسمة . . فأنکر عمر من ذلک (175) فعله وقال لأبی بکر فی أمره ، فاحتجّ عنه (176) بأن قال : إنّما خالد رجل من المسلمین تأوّل فأخطاء (177) . . ! ولم یظهر منه إنکار علیه فی ذلک ، بل نصره ممّن رام الإنکار علیه فیما فعله ، مع ما رواه أهل الحدیث جمیعاً بغیر خلاف ، عن القوم الذین کانوا مع خالد ، إنهم قالوا : أذّن مؤذّننا وأذّن مؤذّنهم ، وصلّینا وصلّوا ، وتشهّدنا الشهادتین وتشهّدوا ; فأی ردّة هاهنا مع ما رووه جمیعاً أن عمر قال لأبی بکر : کیف تقاتل قوماً یشهدون أن لا اله الا الله وأن محمداً رسول الله [ ( صلی الله علیه وآله وسلم ) ] ، وقد سمعت رسول الله [ ( صلی الله علیه وآله وسلم ) ] یقول : « أُمرت أن أُقاتل الناس حتّی یقولوا : لا اله الا الله وأنی رسول الله [ ص ] ، فإذا قالوها حقنوا بها دماءهم وأموالهم إلاّ بحقها وحسابهم علی الله » .

"Then when the people submitted to him in what we described, willingly and unwillingly, a tribe of Arabs refused to pay him the zakat. They said: 'Indeed, the Messenger (peace be upon him and his holy progeny) did not command us to deliver this to you, nor did he command you to demand it from us. So why do you demand from us what neither Allah nor His Messenger commanded?' So, he named them: the People of Rebellion (Ahl al-Radd), and he sent (169) Khalid ibn al-Walid against them, and he killed their fighters, took their children captive, and repurposed their belongings, making all of this a division (170) among the Muslims." They accepted this from him, regarding it as permissible, except for a few who disliked it, among them Umar ibn al-Khattab, who withheld his share from them and he remained with them until he took control of affairs, then he returned it to them, and Khawla bint Ja'far, the mother of Muhammad ibn al-Hanafiyyah, was one of them. So he sent her to the Commander of the Faithful, Ali ibn Abi Talib (peace be upon him), and he married her but did not take her as a possession (171), and the others were made lawful, so their women were married off (172); and Khalid ibn al-Walid, the leader of the people, killed Malik ibn Nuwayra and took his wife, and he lay with her that very night without having cleansed her (173), nor did he buy her (174), nor was there a division of her… Umar disapproved of this (175) action and said to Abu Bakr about it, but he justified it (176) by saying: Khalid is merely a man from the Muslims who interpreted and made a mistake (177)… And he did not show any denial of it from him in that matter, rather he supported him against anyone who attempted to deny what he had done, with what the people of hadith all narrated without exception, from those who were with Khalid, that they said: Our caller called the azaan, and their caller called the azaan, and we prayed and they prayed, and we testified to the two testimonies and they testified; so what is there any apostasy here with what they all narrated that Umar said to Abu Bakr: How can you fight a people who testify that there is no god but Allah and that Muhammad is the Messenger of Allah (peace be upon him and his holy progeny), and I heard the Messenger of Allah (peace be upon him and his holy progeny) say: "I was commanded to fight the people until they say: There is no god but Allah, and Muhammad is the Messenger of Allah (peace be upon him and his holy progeny), and when they say it, their blood and wealth will be protected, except for what is due in it, and their reckoning is with Allah."

footnote.p: 1- فی المصدر : ( الردّة وبعث إلیهم ) .
(169) In the source: "(al-Raddah) and sent to them."
2- فی المصدر : ( فیئاً قسّمه ) .
(170) In the source: "(a division he distributed)."
1- فی المصدر : ( یتملّکها ) .
(171) In the source: (yatakallakuhaa - تَملّکها).
2- فی المصدر : ( فروج نسائهم ) .
(172) In the source: (furooj nisa'ihim - فروج نسائهم).
3- فی المصدر : ( استبراء لها ) .
(173) In the source: (istabra'aa lahaa - استبراء لها).
4- لم یرد فی المصدر : ( ولا اشتراها ) .
(174) Not mentioned in the source: (nor did he buy her).
(175) In the source: (thaalika min - ذلک من).
5- فی المصدر : ( ذلک من ) .
(176) Not mentioned in the source: (from him).
6- لم یرد ( عنه ) فی المصدر .
(177) - In the source: (laysa bi-awwal man akhṭa'a - ليس بأول من أخطأ).

para.p: فقال أبو بکر : لو منعونی عقالا – أو قال : عناقاً (178) – ممّا کانوا یدفعونه إلی رسول الله لقاتلتهم . . أو قال : لجاهدتهم .

Abu Bakr said: "If they had prevented me a strap – or he said, a young goat (178) – of what they used to give to the Messenger of Allah, I would have fought them... or he said, I would have struggled against them."

footnote.p: 1- فی المصدر : ( عتاقاً ) .
(178) In the source: (عَتَاقاً).

para.p: فکان هذا الفعل منه فعلا فظیعاً ، وظلماً عظیماً ، وتعدّیاً بیّناً ; ومن أین له أن یجاهد قوما علی أن منعوه ما کانوا یدفعونه إلی رسول الله ( صلی الله علیه وآله ) [ أ ] (179) بأمر من الله ورسوله أو برأی رآه واستحسنه ؟ !

And this action of his was a monstrous act, a great injustice, and a blatant transgression; and how could he have the right to struggle against a people for having prevented him from what they used to give to the Messenger of Allah (peace be upon him and his holy progeny) (179) by the command of Allah and His Messenger, or by an opinion he saw and found good?

footnote.p: 2- الزیادة من المصدر .
(179) The addition is from the source.

para.p: فإن قال أولیاؤه : بل بأمر من الله ورسوله . . فعلیهم إقامة الدلیل علی صحة ذلک بآیة من کتاب الله ، أو خبر عن رسول الله ( صلی الله علیه وآله ) خاصة باسمه ونسبه ، مجمع علی نقله وتأویله ، ( وَأَنَّی لَهُمُ التَّنَاوُشُ مِن مَکَان بَعِید ) (180) .

If his supporters say: "Rather, by the command of Allah and His Messenger..." then they must provide evidence for the correctness of that with a verse from the Book of Allah, or a narration from the Messenger of Allah (peace be upon him and his holy progeny) specifically mentioning his name and lineage, unanimously transmitted and interpreted, (And how shall the attaining (of faith) be possible to them from a distant place?) (180).

footnote.p: 3- سورة سبأ ( 34 ) : 52 .
(180) Surah Saba (34): 52.

para.p: وإن قالوا: إن ذلک کان منه برأی واستحسان ... قیل لهم : فمن رأی أن یقتل المسلمین ویستبیح أموالهم ویجعلها فیئا ، هل هو عندکم ظالم أو محقّ ؟

And if they say: "That was his action by his own opinion and approval..." it could be said to them: "Is one who intends to kill Muslims and violate their wealth <27>, making it spoils, considered by you to be an unjust person or someone in the right?"
فإن قالوا: [ إنه ] (181) محقّ ; أباحوا دماء المسلمین ، وسبی ذراریهم ، وانتهاک حریمهم ، واستباحة أموالهم ; وقائل هذا خارج عن دین محمد ( صلی الله علیه وآله ) عند کل ذی فهم .

If they say: "[Indeed, he is] (181) in the right;" they have permitted the shedding of Muslim blood, taking captive their children, violating their sanctities, and the unlawful seizure of their wealth; and the one who utters this is outside the religion of Muhammad (peace be upon him and his holy progeny) in the eyes of every understanding person.

footnote.p: 1- الزیادة من المصدر .
(181) The addition is from the source.

para.p: وإن قالوا: إنه ظالم ; فکفی بذلک خزیا وکفراً وجهلا.
And if they say: "He is unjust;" then this alone is sufficient as a disgrace, disbelief, and ignorance.
هذا [مع] (182) ما رووا جمیعاً: إن عمر لم یزل عاتبا علیه وعلی خالد بن الولید أیام حیوته فی ذلک. . . إلی أن قال (183)
This [is] (182) alongside what they all narrated: that Umar was continually reproaching him and Khalid ibn al-Walid during their lifetimes for that... until he said (183):

footnote.p: 2- لم ترد فی المصدر ( هذا ) ، وما بین المعکوفین مزید من المصدر .
(182) This is not mentioned in the source (this), and what is in brackets is an addition from the source.
3- صاحب الاستغاثة . ( 12 ) .
(183) The author of al-Istaghaathah. (12).

para.p: فکان قتل مالک بن نویرة وعشیرته وتسمیتهم بالردّة من عجائب الظلم والبدع العظیمة المنکرة الفظیعة.
So, the killing of Malik ibn Nuwaira and his clan, and labeling them with apostasy (ridda), was one of the wonders of oppression and a great, deniable, and horrifying innovation.

ثم رووا جمیعاً: إن عمر لما ملک الأمر جمع من بقی من عشیرة مالک بن نویرة، واسترجع ما وجد عند المسلمین من أموالهم وأولادهم ونسائهم، فردّ ذلک علیهم ، مع نصیبه الذی کان منهم ، وزعم أهل الروایة : إنه استرجع بعض نسائهم من نواحی تستر (184) ، وبعضهم حوامل ! فردّهن علی أزواجهن.

Then they all narrated that when Umar seized power, he gathered those who remained from the clan of Malik ibn Nuwaira and took back what he found among the Muslims of their wealth, children, and women, returning this to them along with his share that was due from them. The narrators claimed that he retrieved some of their women from the regions of Tustar (184), some of whom were pregnant! He returned them to their husbands.

footnote.p: 4- فی المصدر : ( کثیرة ) .
(184) In the source: (many).

para.p: فإن کان فعل أبی بکر بهم خطاءً، فقد أطعم المسلمین الحرام من أموالهم، وملّکهم العبید الحرام من أولادهم، [ و ] (185) أوطأهم الفروج الحرام من نسائهم . . وفی هذا خزی عظیم ونکال ألیم.

If the action of Abu Bakr towards them was a mistake, then he fed the Muslims with the unlawful from their wealth and made them possessors of the unlawful slaves from their children, [and] (185) degraded them. The unlawful intercourse (al-Furooj al-Haram) with their women... And in this, there is a great disgrace (khizyi) and painful punishment (nikal).

footnote.p: 5- الزیادة من المصدر .
(185) The addition is from the source.

para.p: وإن کان فعله حقاً وصواباً، فقد أخذ عمر نساء من قوم ملکوهنّ بحقّ وانتزعهن (186) من أیدیهم غصبا وظلماً، وردّهن إلی قوم لا یستحقونهن یطاؤنهن حراماً ; من غیر متابعة (187) وقعت، ولا أثمان دفعت.

And although his action was indeed just and correct, Umar took the women of a people whom he had rightful ownership over and forcibly and unjustly (186) seized them from their hands and returned them to a people who did not deserve them, who would trample upon them unlawfully; without any pursuit (187) occurring, or prices being paid.

footnote.p: 1- فی المصدر ( وابتزّهنّ ) .
(186) In the source, it states (wa-ibtazzahunna).
2- فی المصدر ( مبایعة ) ، وهو الظاهر .
(187) In the source, it states (mubay'a), which is the apparent meaning.

para.p: ففی کلا (188) الحالین قد أوطئا جمیعاً – أو أحدهما – المسلمین فروجا حراما، وأطعماهم – أو أحدهما – مالا حراماً من أموال المقتولین علی منع الزکاة منه، وأولادهم ونسائهم.

So, in both (188) cases, they may have collectively – or one of them – provided the Muslims with unlawful intercourses (furooj haram) and fed them – or one of them – with unlawful wealth from the possessions of those killed for the sake of withholding zakat from it, and their children and women.

footnote.p: 3- در [ الف ] اشتباهاً : ( کلّ ) آمده است .
(188) The phrase (kul) appears in [A] by mistake.

para.p: فلیثبت الآن أولیاؤهم أیّ الحالتین شاؤوا، ولینفوا منهما أیّهما شاؤوا، فما یجدون عن ذلک فی حقیقة النظر محیصاً ، ولیس فیهما ولا فی واحدة منهما حظّ لمختار ، وما منهما إلا من قد فعل ما لا یرضاه الله ولا رسوله منه ، إذ کان فی ذلک هتک [ حرمة ] (189) المسلمین وإبطال أحکام شریعة الدین (190) .

Now, their heirs may affirm whichever of the two situations they wish, and deny either of them as they wish, for they will find none of this in the realm of true consideration to be an escape, and there is no advantage in either of them, nor in just one of them, for a chosen one (mukhtar), and neither of them is anything other than one who has done what Allah and His Messenger would not be pleased with, as it involves the violation [of the sanctity] (189) of the Muslims and the nullification of the rulings of the Shariah of the religion (190).

footnote.p: 4- الزیادة من المصدر .
(189) The addition is from the source.
5- الاستغاثة 1 / 5 - 9 ( چاپ دیگر 1 / 8 - 12 ) .
(190) Al-Istighatha 1 / 5-9 (another edition 1 / 8-12).

para.p: و از این بیان معلوم شد که : طعن بر ابوبکر در این قصه ، محض از جهت عدم اخذ قصاص مالک بن نویره از خالد ، و ترک اجرای حد زنا بر وی نیست ، بلکه ابوبکر به جهت فرستادن لشکر برای قتال قوم مالک بن نویره نیز مطعون است .

From this statement, it becomes clear that: the criticism of Abu Bakr in this matter is not solely due to his failure to seek retribution (qisas) from Malik ibn Nuwayra for Khalid, and his neglect to enforce punishment (hadd) for adultery (zina) upon him. Rather, Abu Bakr is also criticized for sending an army to fight the people of Malik ibn Nuwayra.
و دلیل این معنا که این قوم اقرار به وجوب زکات داشتند و از ادای آن به ابوبکر امتناع نمودند آن است که جلال الدین سیوطی (1) در تفسیر “ درّمنثور “ گفته :
And the reason for this is that these people affirmed the obligation of Zakat yet refused to pay it to Abu Bakr. This is because Jalal al-Din al-Suyuti (191) stated the Tafsir, "Durre Manthur":

footnote.p: 1- [ الف و ب ] لوامع من تعریفه : هو الإمام الحافظ أبو الفضل جلال الدین عبد الرحمن [ بن الکمال ] أبی بکر بن محمد بن أبی بکر بن عثمان بن محمد بن خضر بن أیوب بن محمد السیوطی - بتثلیث السین المهملة - ویقال أیضاً : الأسیوطی بضم الهمزه وفتحها - المصری الشافعی ، وُلد بعد المغرب لیلة الأحد غرّة رجب سنة تسع وأربعین وثمان مائة بالقاهرة ، وکان یلقّب ب : ابن الکتب ; لأن أباه أمر أُمّه - وکانت أُمّ ولد له - أن یأتیه بکتاب من بین الکتب ، فذهبت لتأتی به فأجاءها المخاض وهی بین الکتب ، فوضعته بینها ; ولقب والده [ ولقبه والده ب ] : جلال الدین ، وکنی [ وکنّاه ] شیخه العزّ أحمد بن ابراهیم الکنانی : أبا الفضل ، وأحضره والده - وعمره ثلاث سنین - مجلس شیخ الإسلام ابن حجر مرّة واحدة ، وحجّ وشرب ماء زمزم علی أن یکون فی الحدیث کالحافظ ابن حجر ، وفی الفقه کالسراج البلقینی ، وتولّی مشیخات کثیرة ، وزهد آخراً فی جمیعها ، وانقطع إلی الله تعالی ; وکانت له کرامات ، وعظم غالبها بعد وفاته . وذکر زکریا بن محمد المحملی الشافعی أحد الفضلاء من تلامذته : إنه اطّلعه علی ورقة وفیها : إنه [ أی السیوطی ] اجتمع بالنبیّ صلی الله علیه [ وآله ] وسلّم فی الیقظة مرّات تزید علی سبعین ! وحکی أنه قال - فی المنام - : کأنّی بین یدیه صلی الله علیه [ وآله ] وسلّم فذکرت له کتاباً شرعت فی تألیفه فی الحدیث - وهو جمع الجوامع - فقلت له : أقرأ علیکم شیئاً منه ، فقال لی : هات - یا شیخ ! - الحدیث . قال : هذه البشری عندی أعظم من الدنیا بحذافیرها . روی عن علم الدین صالح بن السرّاج عمر بن البلقینی ، وأبی بریر عبد الرحمن بن علی بن عمر الملقن ، وتقی الدین أحمد بن محمد الشمنی ، وأبی بکر بن صدقة المناوی ، وأبی الفضل المرجانی ، وأبی العباس طریف الشاوی ، وتقی الدین بن فهد المکی ، وبالإجازة عن محمد بن مقبل الحلبی . . فی آخرین یجمعهم معجمه . وله التصانیف التی عمّ نفعها ، وعظم فی نفوس ذوی الکمال وقعها ، واغتبط بها الشاوی والبادی ، وأهجع إلی حصیب مرعاها المحاضر والبادی ، وقد أفرد أسماءها فی جزء مرتباً لها علی الفنون ، وزادت فی العدد علی خمس مائة سوی ما رجع عنه وغسله ، فمن عیونها - غیر ما تقدم - : الدرّ المنثور فی التفسیر بالمأثور . . إلی آخره . مفتاح کنز الدرایة . ( 12 ) . [ موارد داخل کروشه استظهار ماست مصدر در دسترس نبود تا مطلب مطابق آن تصحیح شود ] .

(191) [A and B] Lawami' min Tarikhih: He is the imam and hadith scholar, Abu al-Fadl Jalal al-Din Abd al-Rahman [ibn al-Kamal] Abu Bakr ibn Muhammad ibn Abu Bakr ibn Uthman ibn Muhammad ibn Khidr ibn Ayyub ibn Muhammad al-Suyuti - with a three-dotted ta - and he is also called al-Asiyuti, with or without the hamzah - the Egyptian Shafi'i, born after the Maghrib prayer on the night of Sunday, the 1st of Rajab in the year 949 AH in Cairo. He was nicknamed Ibn al-Kutub because his father instructed his mother - who was a concubine of his - to bring him a book from among the books. She went to fetch it, but while she was among the books, labor came upon her, and she gave birth to him there. His father titled him Jalaal al-Din, and his teacher al-Aziz Ahmad ibn Ibrahim al-Kinani [nicknamed him] Abu al-Fadl. His father brought him - when he was three years old - to attend a gathering of Shaykh al-Islam Ibn Hajar once, and he performed pilgrimage and drank from the water of Zamzam on the condition that he be like al-Hafiz Ibn Hajar in hadith and like al-Siraj al-Balqini in jurisprudence. He held many positions of teaching but later became indifferent to them all, devoting himself to Allah, the Exalted; and he had miracles, with most of them being magnified after his death. Zakariya ibn Muhammad al-Mahmali al-Shafi'i, one of the virtuous scholars among his students, mentioned that he showed him a paper stating that he [al-Suyuti] met the Prophet, peace be upon him and his holy progeny, and blessed be his sacred essence, in wakefulness several times, exceeding seventy! It was reported that he said - in a dream -: "I am as if I am before him, peace be upon him and his holy progeny, and I mentioned to him a book I had begun to author on hadith" - which is Jami' al-Jawami' - "and I said to him, 'Shall I read you something from it?' He replied, 'Bring it on, O Shaikh!' The hadith. He said, 'This good news is greater to me than the entire world and whatever is in it.'" He narrated from Ilm al-Din Salih ibn al-Sarraj Umar ibn al-Balqini, Abi Burair Abd al-Rahman ibn Ali ibn Umar al-Muqann, Taqi al-Din Ahmad ibn Muhammad al-Shamuni, Abu Bakr ibn Sadaqa al-Manawi, Abu al-Fadl al-Marjani, Abu al-Abbas Tarif al-Shawqi, Taqi al-Din ibn Fahd al-Makki, and by authorization from Muhammad ibn Muqbil al-Halabi... among others, and his compilations will be gathered in his index. He has written works whose benefits were widespread, and their impact was great in the eyes of the people of perfection. The scholars and the unlearned rejoiced in them, while the aware and the unlearned found peace in their presence. He dedicated a separate volume listing their names, arranged by subject, and their number exceeded five hundred, aside from what he later withdrew and revised. Among his notable works - besides the ones mentioned - are Al-Durr al-Manthur fi al-Tafsir bil-Ma'thur… and so on. Miftah Kanz al-Darayah (Key to the Treasure of Knowledge). (12). [Items in brackets are our interpretations; a source was not available to correct the text accordingly.]

para.p: أخرج عبد الرزاق والعدنی وابن المنذر والحاکم عن عمر، قال : لئن أکون سألت النبیّ عن ثلاث أحبّ إلیّ من حمر النعم : عن الخلیفة بعده ، وعن قوم قالوا : نقرّ بالزکاة من أموالنا ولا نؤدّیها إلیک ، أیحلّ قتالهم ؟ وعن الکلالة (192).

Abd al-Razzaq, al-Adni, Ibn al-Mundhir, and al-Hakim narrated from Umar, who said: "I swear, to ask the Prophet (peace be upon him and his holy progeny) about three things would be dearer to me than red camels: about the caliph after him, about a people who said, 'We will acknowledge the zakat from our wealth but we will not pay it to you. Is it lawful to fight them?' and about al-Kalalah (the near relatives) (192)."

footnote.p: 1- [ الف ] سوره نساء جزء ششم تفسیر قوله تعالی : ( یَسْتَفْتُونَکَ ) [ ب ] الدرّ المنثور 2 / 249 ( طبع بیروت ) .
(192) [A] Surah An-Nisa, Chapter 4, Part 6, interpreting His statement, Almighty and Glorious be He: (They ask you for a ruling) [b] Durre Manthur 2 / 249 (Beirut edition).

para.p: یعنی اخراج کرد عبدالرزاق و عدنی و ابن منذر و حاکم از عمر که : اگر سؤال میکردم پیغمبر خدا ( صلی الله علیه وآله ) را از سه چیز ، دوست تر میبود نزد من از شتران ‹ 28 › سرخ موی : اول از اینکه خلیفه بعد از آن حضرت کدام کس است ، دوم از حال قومی که گفتند که ما اقرار به وجوب زکات در اموال خود میکنیم و ادا نمیکنیم به تو ، آیا حلال است قتال ایشان ، و از معنای ( کلاله ) .

Meaning, Abd al-Razzaq, al-Adni, Ibn al-Mundhir, and al-Hakim narrated from Umar that: asking the Messenger of Allah (peace be upon him and his holy progeny) about three things would be more beloved to me than two red-haired camels <28>: First, regarding who the caliph after that Prophet (peace be upon him and his holy progeny) is, second, about the condition of a people who said that we acknowledge the obligation of zakat on our wealth but will not pay it to you. Is it permissible to fight them, and about the meaning of (kalaalah)?
و شیخ عبدالحق در “ مدارج النبوه “ آورده :
And Shaikh Abdul Haq mentioned in "Madarij an-Nubuwwah":

در “ اصابه “ میآرد که : مالک بن نویره التمیمی الیربوعی ، تَکنیه کرده میشود به : ابوحنظله ، و لقب کرده میشود به ( معول ) (1) ، گفت مرزبانی : [ بود ] (2) شاعر شریف فارس معدود در فرسان بنی یربوع در جاهلیت ، و عامل ساخته بود آن حضرت او را بر صدقات خویش (3) ، چون رسید او را خبر وفات رسول ( صلی الله علیه وآله ) امساک کرد صدقه را و تفریق کرد در قومش و این شعر گفت :

In "Isabah” it is stated that: Malik ibn Nuwayrah at-Tamimi al-Yarbou’i, was nicknamed Abu Hanzalah and titled (Ma'wal) (193). Marzabani said: [he was (194)] a noble poet, and a knight among the knights of Bani Yarbou’ in the Days of Ignorance (Jahiliyyah), and that the Prophet (peace be upon him and his holy progeny) had appointed him as an overseer over his alms (sadaqat) (195). When he received the news of the death of the Messenger (peace be upon him and his holy progeny), he withheld the almsgiving (sadaqa) and distributed it among his people, and he recited this poem:

footnote.p: 1- در الاصابه : ( الجفول ) و در مدارج النبوة : ( حضول ) آمده است .
(193) In Isabah: (al-Jaful) and in Madarij an-Nubuwwah: (Hadhul) is mentioned.
2- زیاده از مصدر .
(194) An addition from the source.
3- در مصدر : ( قومش ) .
(195) In the source: (his people).

para.p: فقلت خذوا أموالکم غیر خائف
So, I said, take your wealth without fear
ولا ناظر فیما یجیء من الغد
nor look at what may come tomorrow.
فإن قام بالدین المحقّق قائم
For if a rightful one arises to establish the religion
أطعنا وقلنا : الدین دین محمد ( صلی الله علیه وآله ) (196)
we will obey and say: The religion is the religion of Muhammad (peace be upon him and his holy progeny) (196)

footnote.p: 4- [ ب ] مدارج النبوه 2 / 690 ( طبع هند ) . [ و مراجعه شود به الاصابة 5 / 560 ] .
(196) [B] Madarij an-Nubuwwah 2 / 690 (Indian edition). [And see Isabah 5 / 560].

para.p: و هرگاه این را دانستی ، پس بدان که : مجموع این طعن مأخوذ است از کلام عمر ، چنانچه در “ مشکاة “ از “ صحیح بخاری “ و “ صحیح مسلم “ به روایت ابوهریره مذکور است :

And whenever you understand this, then know that: the entirety of this reproach is derived from the words of Umar, just as mentioned in "Mishkat" from "Sahih Bukhari" and "Sahih Muslim" narrated by Abu Huraira:

قال: لمّا توفی رسول الله صلی الله علیه [ وآله ] وسلّم واستخلف أبو بکر وکفر من کفر من العرب ; قال عمر بن الخطاب لأبی بکر : کیف تقاتل الناس وقد قال رسول الله صلی الله علیه [ وآله ] وسلّم : أُمرت أن أُقاتل الناس حتّی یقولوا : لا إله إلا الله ، فمن قال : لا إله إلا الله ، عصم منی ماله ونفسه إلا بحقه ، وحسابه علی الله .

He said: When the Messenger of Allah (peace be upon him [and his holy progeny]) passed away and Abu Bakr was appointed as his successor, and many of the Arabs turned to disbelief, Umar ibn al-Khattab said to Abu Bakr: How can you fight the people when the Messenger of Allah (peace be upon him [and his holy progeny]) said: "I was commanded to fight the people until they say, 'There is no god but Allah,' so whoever says, 'There is no god but Allah,' his wealth and life are sacred from me, except by right, and his reckoning is with Allah"?

فقال أبو بکر : لأُقاتلن من فرّق بین الصلاة والزکاة ، فإن الزکاة حق المال ، والله لو منعونی عناقا (197) کانوا یؤدّونها إلی رسول الله صلی الله علیه [ وآله ] وسلّم لقاتلتهم علی منعها . انتهی بقدر الحاجة (198) .

Abu Bakr replied: I will certainly fight those who differentiate between prayer and zakat, for zakat is the right of wealth, and by Allah, if they were to withhold from me a single goat (197) that they used to give to the Messenger of Allah (peace be upon him and his holy progeny), I would fight them for withholding it. This concludes what is needed (198).

footnote.p: 1- فی صحیح مسلم : ( عقالا ) .
(197) In Sahih Muslim: (Iqalan).
2- [ الف ] فصل سوم از کتاب الزکاة . [ ب ] 1 / 563 ( طبع دمشق 1380 ) . [ مشکاة المصابیح 1 / 561 ، صحیح مسلم 1 / 38 ، صحیح بخاری 8 / 50 ، 140 ، 162 ] .
(198) [A] Chapter Three of the Book of Zakat. [b] 1 / 563 (Damascus edition 1380). [Mishkat al-Masabih 1 / 561, Sahih Muslim 1 / 38, Sahih Bukhari 8 / 50, 140, 162].

para.p: و در “ تاریخ کبیر طبری “ (3) مذکور است :
And it is mentioned in "Tarikh Kabir Tabari" (199):

footnote.p: 3- [ الف و ب ] مناقب عالیه ابن جریر طبری و مقام او و تصنیفاتش بر ناظر “ تاریخ “ یافعی [ مرآة الجنان 2 / 261 ] و ابن خلّکان [ وفیات الأعیان 4 / 126 - 127 ، 191 ] و “ طبقات “ سبکی [ 3 / 120 ] و “ طبقات “ ابن الجماعه [ طبقات الشافعیة 1 / 101 - 102 ] و “ انساب “ سمعانی [ 4 / 46 - 47 ] و “ تراجم الحفاظ “ میرزا محمد بن معتمدخان بدخشانی و “ مفتاح کنز الدرایة “ و “ مختصر تاریخ بغداد “ [ تاریخ بغداد 2 / 159 - 165 ] و “ تهذیب الاسماء “ نووی و “ مفهم شرح صحیح مسلم “ [ 1 / 95 ] و “ صواقع “ نصرالله کابلی [ الصواقع ، ورق : 77 - 78 ، 80 - 81 ، 86 - 87 ] ، بلکه باب دوم همین کتاب “ تحفه “ [ صفحه 57 ، کید 52 ] مخفی نیست ، و یاقوت حموی در “ معجم الادباء “ بر زبان خطیب ، او را به این الفاظ میستاید : کان أحد الأئمة العلماء ، یحکم بقوله ویرجع إلی رأیه لمعرفته وفضله ، وکان قد جمع من العلوم ما لم یشارکه فیه أحد من أهل عصره ، وکان حافظاً لکتاب الله عزّوجلّ ، عارفاً بالقراءات ، بصیراً بالمعانی ، فقیهاً بأحکام القرآن ، عالماً بالسنن وطرقها صحیحها وسقیمها ، وناسخها ومنسوخها ، عارفاً بأقوال الصحابة والتابعین ومن بعدهم من المخالفین فی الأحکام ومسائل الحلال والحرام ، عارفاً بأیام الناس وأخبارهم ، وله الکتاب المشهور فی تاریخ الأُمم والملوک . انتهی . [ معجم الادباء 5 / 243 ] .

(199) [A and B] Manaqib Aliyyah Ibn Jarir Tabari and his status and writings were noted by the observer of the "History" Yafi'i [Mir'at al-Janan 2 / 261] and Ibn Khalkan [Wafi'at al-A'yaan 4 / 126-127, 191], and in the "Tabaqat" of Subki [3 / 120] and the "Tabaqat" of Ibn Jamma'ah [Tabaqat al-Shafi'iyah 1 / 101-102], and in the "Ansab" of Sam'ani [4 / 46-47], and in the "Tarajim al-Huffaz" of Mirza Muhammad ibn Mu'tamid Khan Badakhshani, and in "Miftah Kenz al-Darayah" and "Mukhtasar Tarikh Baghdad" [Tarikh Baghdad 2 / 159-165], and in "Tahdhib al-Asma'" Nawawi, and "Mafhum Sharh Sahih Muslim" [1 / 95], and "Sawa'iq" Nasrullah Kabuli [Sawa'iq, folios 77-78, 80-81, 86-87], and indeed, the second chapter of this book "Tuhfa" [page 57, Ki'd 52] does not remain hidden, and Yaqut al-Hamawi in "Mu'jam al-Adabaa'" praises him through the tongue of a speaker with these words: He was one of the imams and scholars, whose judgments were upheld and whose opinions were referred to due to his knowledge and virtue, and he had gathered knowledge that no one among the people of his time could share with him, and he was a memorizer of the Book of Allah, the Mighty and Majestic, knowledgeable of the recitations, perceptive of the meanings, knowledgeable in the rulings of the Quran, an expert in the Sunnah and their authentic and inauthentic paths, their abrogators and abrogated, familiar with the statements of the companions and followers, and those after them from the dissenters in rulings and matters of lawful and unlawful, knowledgeable of the days of the people and their news, and he had a well-known book on the history of nations and kings. End. [Mu'jam al-Adabaa' 5 / 243].

para.p: حدّثنا ابن حمید قال : حدّثنا سلمة ، قال : حدّثنا محمد بن اسحاق ، عن طلحة بن عبد الله [ بن عبد الرحمن ] (200) بن أبی بکر الصدیق : إن أبا بکر کان من عهده إلی جیوشه :

Ibn Humayd narrated to us, who said: Salamah narrated to us, who said: Muhammad ibn Ishaq narrated to us, from Talhah ibn Abdullah [ibn Abdurrahman] (200) ibn Abi Bakr as-Siddiq: Indeed, Abu Bakr was telling his armies from his time of leadership:

footnote.p: 1- الزیادة من المصدر .
(200) The addition is from the source.

para.p: إذا غشیتم (201) دارا من دور الناس فسمعتم (202) فیها أذانا للصلاة فأمسکوا عن أهلها حتّی تسألوهم: ما الذی نقموا؟ وإن لم تسمعوا أذانا فشنّوا الغارة فاقتلوا وحرّقوا.

"If you approach (201) a house from the houses of the people and hear (202) an adhan for prayer within it, then refrain from the inhabitants until you ask them: What is it that they oppose? But if you do not hear an adhan, then launch an attack, kill, and burn."

footnote.p: 2- در [ الف ] اشتباهاً : ( غشیتهم ) آمده است .
(201) In [A], mistakenly: (Ghashaytuhum) is mentioned.
3- در [ الف ] اشتباهاً : ( فسمعتهم ) آمده است .
(202) In [A], mistakenly: (Fasami'tuhum) is mentioned.

para.p: وکان ممّن شهد لمالک بالإسلام أبو قتادة الحارث بن ربعی أخو بنی سلمة ، وقد کان عاهد الله : ألاّ یشهد مع خالد حرباً أبدا بعدها .
And among those who witnessed to Malik's Islam was Abu Qatadah al-Harith ibn Rubi', the brother of Banu Salamah, and he had pledged to Allah: never to fight alongside Khalid again after that.
وکان یحدّث: إنهم لمّا غشّوا القوم راعوهم تحت اللیل فأخذ القوم السلاح.
And he would narrate: When they surrounded the people, they terrified them under the night, and the people took up arms.
قال: فقلنا: إنا المسلمون، فقالوا: ونحن المسلمون، قلنا: فما بال السلاح [معکم؟! قالوا لنا: فما بال السلاح معکم؟ ! قالوا : فإن کنتم کما تقولون فضعوا السلاح ] (203) قال : فوضعوها ، ثم صلّینا وصلّوا .

He said: So we said, "We are Muslims," and they replied, "And we are Muslims." We said, "Then what is the matter with the weapons [with you?]" They said to us, "And what is the matter with the weapons with you?" They said, "If you are as you say, then lay down the weapons." (203) He said: So they laid them down, and then we prayed, and they prayed.

footnote.p: 1- الزیادة من المصدر و [ ب ] .
(203) Addition from the source and [B].

para.p: وکان خالد یعتذر فی قتله أنه قال – وهو یراجعه -: ما أخال صاحبکم إلاّ کان یقول. . . کذا وکذا، قال: أو ما تعدّه لک صاحباً؟! ثم قدّمه فضرب عنقه وأعناق أصحابه.

And Khalid would excuse himself in the killing, saying – while being confronted -: "I do not think your companion was saying anything other than... this and that." He said, "Do you not consider him to be your companion?!" Then he stepped forward and struck off his neck and the necks of his companions.
فلمّا بلغ قتلهم عمر بن الخطاب، تکلّم فیه عند أبی بکر، فأکثر، فقال: عدو الله غدا (204) علی امرء مسلم فقتله، ثم نزا علی امرأته!

So when the news of their killing reached Umar ibn al-Khattab, he spoke about it to Abu Bakr, and he spoke at length. He said, "Enemy of Allah, he went out (204) against a Muslim man and killed him, and then he assaulted his wife!"

footnote.p: 2- فی المصدر : ( عدا ) ، وهو الظاهر .
(204) In the source: (عَدَا), which is the apparent meaning.

para.p: وأقبل خالد بن الولید قافلا حتّی دخل المسجد وعلیه قباء له علیه صدأ الحدید ، معتجراً بعمامة له ، قد عزز (205) فی عمامته أسهما ، فلمّا دخل إلیه وأتی إلی المسجد قام إلیه عمر فانتزع الأسهم من رأسه فحطمها ، ثم قال : اریاء (206) قتلت امرأً مسلماً ثم نزوت علی امرأته ؟ ! والله لأرجمنّک بأحجارک . وخالد لا یکلمه (207) .

And Khalid ibn al-Walid returned, making his way back until he entered the mosque, wearing a cloak that had rust from iron <29> on it, his head wrapped in a turban, in which he had inserted (205) arrows. When he entered and approached the mosque, Umar stood up to him, seized the arrows from his head, and shattered them, then said: "Hypocrites (206), you killed a muslim man, then did you climb on top of his wife?! By God, I will surely stone you with your stones. And Khalid will not speak to him (207).

footnote.p: 3- فی المصدر : ( غرز ) .
(205) In the source: (غَرَز), meaning to insert.
4- فی المصدر : ( أرئاء ) .
(206) In the source: (أَرْئِيَاء), meaning hypocrites.

1- [ الف ] جزء خامس از تاریخ مذکور . ( 12 ) . [ ب ] تاریخ الطبری 3 / 242 ( طبع مصر سنه 1336 ) . [ تاریخ الطبری 2 / 503 - 504 ] . [ الف و ب ] و بحمدالله تعالی نسخه “ تاریخ کبیر “ طبری نزد فقیر موجود است ، هر کس را در صحت نقل شک باشد ، نزد حقیر آید و به تطبیق آن پردازد ، بلکه نسخه آن چهاپه جرمن [ = آلمان ] در کتب خانه مدرسه دهلی نیز هست در آنجا به ملاحظه اش پردازد . ( 12 ) .

(207) [A] A fifth volume of the mentioned history. (12). [B] Tarikh al-Tabari 3/242 (printed in Cairo, 1336 AH). [Tarikh al-Tabari 2/503-504]. [A and B] And, praise be to God Almighty, a copy of the “Tarikh Kabir” by Tabari is available with this humble one. Anyone who doubts the accuracy of the narration may come to me and compare it, or rather, a copy of it is also available in four volumes in German in the library of the school in Delhi, where it can be examined. (12).

para.p: و ملا علی متقی در کتاب “ کنزالعمال “ - تبویب “ جمع الجوامع “ سیوطی - نقل کرده :
And Mulla Ali Muttaqi narrated in the book “Kanz al-Ummal” – under the chapter in “Jama' al-Jawami'” by Suyuti – that he said:

عن ابن أبی عون وغیره: إن خالد بن الولید ادعی أن مالک بن نویرة ارتد بکلام بلغه عنه ، فأنکر مالک ذلک وقال : أنا علی الإسلام ، ما غیّرت ولا بدّلت ، وشهد له أبو قتاده وعبد الله بن عمر ، فقدّمه خالد وأمر ضرار (208) بن الأزور الأسدی فضرب عنقه ، وقبض خالد امرأته ام متمّم فتزوّجها ، فبلغ عمر بن الخطاب قتله مالک بن نویرة وتزوّجه امرأته (209) .

From Ibn Abi Awn and others: Indeed, Khalid ibn al-Walid claimed that Malik ibn Nuwayra had apostasized due to something he heard about him, but Malik denied this and said: I am upon Islam, I have neither changed nor altered. Abu Qatadah and Abdullah ibn Umar testified in his favor. Khalid then appointed him and ordered Durar (208) ibn al-Azwar al-Asadi to strike his neck, and Khalid took Malik's wife, Umm Tamamm, and married her. It was reported to Umar ibn al-Khattab that he killed Malik ibn Nuwayra and married his wife (209).

footnote.p: 2- ضرار - ککتاب - ابن الأزور . ( 12 ) ق . [ القاموس المحیط 2 / 3 ، وزاد : قاتل مالک بن نویرة ] .
(208) Durar - like the book - ibn al-Azwar. (12) Q. [Al-Qamus al-Muhit 2/3, and added: the killer of Malik ibn Nuwayra].

3- از ( ام متمم ) تا اینجا در کنزالعمال ( طبع مؤسسة الرسالة ، بیروت ) حذف شده بود ، ولی کاندهلوی در کتاب حیاة الصحابة در الباب التاسع در بخش ( تأویل فعل المسلم ) 2 / 223 ( چاپ دار صادر بیروت 1998 ) مطلب را کامل - به همان نحوی که مؤلف ( رحمه الله ) نقل نموده - از چاپ دیگر کنزالعمال 3 / 132 آورده است .

(209) From (Umm Tamamm) to here, it was omitted in Kanz al-Amal (printed by Mu'assassat al-Risalah, Beirut), but Kandahlawi completed the account in the book Hayat al-Sahabah in the ninth chapter, in the section (Interpretation of the Actions of a Muslim) 2/223 (Dar Sader, Beirut 1998) - exactly as the author (may Allah have mercy on him) narrated it - from another edition of Kanz al-Amal 3/132.

para.p: قال: لأبی بکر : إنه قد زنا فارجمه ; فقال أبو بکر : ما کنت لأرجمه . . تأوّل فأخطأ! وقال: إنه قد قتل مسلماً فاقتله ; قال : ماکنت لأقتله ، تأوّل فأخطأ ! قال : فاعزله ; قال : ماکنت لأشیم سیفا سلّه الله علیهم أبداً . ابن سعد. (210) .

He said to Abu Bakr: "He has committed zina (adultery), so stone him." Abu Bakr replied: "I would not stone him... He interpreted (ta'awwul) and made a mistake!" And he said: "He has killed a Muslim, so kill him." He said: "I would not kill him; he interpreted (ta'awwul) and made a mistake!" He said: "Then depose him." He replied: "I would not brandish a sword that Allah has set upon them forever." Ibn Sa'd. (210)

footnote.p: 1- [ الف ] کتاب الامارة و الخلافة ، خلافة أبی بکر . ( 12 ) . [ ب ] کنزالعمال : 3 / 132 . [ کنزالعمال : 5 / 619 ( طبع مؤسسة الرسالة ، بیروت ) جامع الأحادیث ( جمع الجوامع ) 13 / 94 ] .
(210) [A] Book of Leadership and Caliphate, The Caliphate of Abu Bakr. (12). [B] Kanz al-Ummal: 3 / 132. [Kanz al-Ummal: 5 / 619 (printed by Maktabat al-Resalah, Beirut) Jami' al-Jawaami' 13 / 94].

para.p: و در “ تاریخ ابن خلّکان “ (2) مذکور است :
And it is mentioned in "Tarikh Ibn Khalkan" (211):

footnote.p: 2- [ ب ] فی مرآة الجنان للیافعی - فی وقائع سنه إحدی وثمانین و ست مائة - : فیها توفّی قاضی القضاة شمس الدین أبو العباس أحمد بن محمد الأرملی [ الاربلی ] الشافعی المعروف [ ب : ] ابن خلّکان ، صاحب التاریخ ، وولد سنة ثمان وستة مائة ، وسمع البخاری من ابن مکرم ، و أجاز له مجید الطوسی وجماعة ، و تفقّه بالموصل علی الکمال بن یونس ، و [ ب ] الشام علی ابن شدّاد ، و لقی کبّار العلماء ، و برع فی الفضائل و الآداب ، کان عالماً ، بارعاً ، عارفاً بالمذهب وفنونه ، سدید الفتاوی ، جید القریحة ، وقوراً ، رئیساً ، حسن المذاکرة ، حلو المحاضرة ، بصیراً بالشعر ، جمیل الأخلاق ، زکیاً ، أخباریاً ، عارفاً بأیام الناس ، له کتاب وفیات الأعیان ، وهو من أحسن ما صنّف فی هذا الفن . انتهی مختصراً . [ مرآة الجنان 4 / 193 ] .

(211) [B] In Mir'at al-Janan by Yaafi'i -in the events of the year 618 and six hundred- it is stated: "In it, Qazi al-Qozat Shams al-Din Abu al-Abbas Ahmad ibn Muhammad al-Armali [al-Urbili] al-Shafi'i, known as Ibn Khallikan, the author of “Tarikh”, passed away. He was born in the year 608 and six hundred, heard al-Bukhari from Ibn Mukarram, and was authorized by Majid al-Tusi and others. He studied fiqh in Mosul under Kamal ibn Yunus, and [B] in Shaam under Ibn Shaddad, and met senior scholars, excelled in virtues and etiquette, and was a knowledgeable, proficient, and understanding scholar of the madhhab and its branches, sound in fatwas, with a good intellect, dignified, a leader, pleasant in discussions, delightful in gatherings, insightful in poetry, with beautiful morals, pure, an accomplished scholar, knowledgeable of people's days. He has a book entitled Waafiyaat al-A'yaan, which is one of the best works compiled in this field." Ended, briefly. [Mir'at al-Janan 4 / 193].

para.p: لمّا بلغ الخبر – أی خبر خالد مع مالک وامرأته – أبا بکر وعمر، فقال عمر لأبی بکر : إن خالدا زنا فارجمه قال : ماکنت لأرجمه فإنه تأول فأخطأ ; قال : فإنه قتل مسلما فاقتله به (212) ; قال : ما کنت لأقتله به ، فإنه تأول فأخطأ ; قال : فاعزله ; قال : ما کنت لأشیم سیفا سلّه الله علیهم أبداً ! ! (213)

When the news -the news of Khalid with Malik and his wife- reached Abu Bakr and Umar, Umar said to Abu Bakr: "Indeed, Khalid has committed zina (adultery), so stone him." He replied: "I would not stone him, for he interpreted and made a mistake." Umar said: "Indeed, he killed a Muslim, so kill him in retaliation (qisas) for that Muslim. (212)" Abu Bakr said: "I would not kill Khalid in retaliation for Malik, for he interpreted and made a mistake." Umar continued: "Then remove him from his position." Abu Bakr responded: "I would not place a sheathed sword that Allah, the Exalted, has drawn against them forever!" (213)

footnote.p: 1- در [ الف ] ( فاقتله مسلما ) اشتباهاً تکرار شده است .
(212) In [A] (faaqatalhu Musliman) it has been mistakenly repeated.
2- [ الف ] عبارت ابن خلّکان در ترجمه وثیمه [ بن الفرات ] است . [ ب ] وفیات الاعیان 5 / 67 مصر سنه 1367 . [ وفیات الاعیان 6 / 15 ] .
(213) [A] is a statement from Ibn Khallikan in the biography of Wuthaymah [bin al-Furat]. [B] Wafiyyat al-A'yaan 5/67, Egypt, year 1367. [Wafiyyat al-A'yaan 6/15].

para.p: یعنی هرگاه که خبر خالد رسید ابوبکر و عمر را ، گفت عمر با ابوبکر : به درستی که خالد زنا کرده ، پس رجم کن او را . ابوبکر گفت : من رجم نخواهم کرد او را ; زیرا که او تأویل کرد پس خطا کرد .

Meaning whenever news of Khalid reached Abu Bakr and Umar, Umar would say to Abu Bakr: "Indeed, Khalid has committed zina, so stone him." Abu Bakr would say: "I will not stone him; because he interpreted and made a mistake."
باز عمر گفت : به درستی که او مسلمی را کشت ، تو او را به قصاص آن مسلم بکش .
Umar would again say: "Indeed, he killed a Muslim, you should kill him in retaliation for that Muslim."
ابوبکر گفت : نخواهم کشت من خالد را به قصاص مالک ، به درستی که او تأویل نمود ، پس خطا کرد .
Abu Bakr would reply: "I will not kill Khalid in retaliation for Malik, for he interpreted and made a mistake."
باز عمر گفت : معزول کن او را .
Umar would then say: "Remove him from his position."
ابوبکر گفت : من در غلاف نخواهم گذاشت گاهی سیفی را که خدای تعالی بر کفار کشیده (3) .
Abu Bakr would answer: "I will not leave a sheathed sword that Allah, the Exalted, has drawn against the disbelievers at any time!" (214)

footnote.p: 3- [ الف و ب ] و سبط ابن الجوزی در “ مرآة الزمان “ گفته : ذکر عزل خالد بن الولید عن الشام : لم یزل عمر ساخطاً علی خالد مدّة خلافة أبی بکر لکلام کان یبلغه عنه من الاستخفاف به وإطراح جانبه ، وما کان یسمّیه إلاّ باسم أُمّه وب : الأعیسر ، وکان یحثّ أبا بکر علی عزله ، ویحرّضه علی قتله بسبب قتله لمالک ، وکان أبو بکر یتوقّف ، فلمّا مات أبو بکر وولّی عمر ، قال : والله لا یلی [ لی ] خالد عملا أبداً . فی الباب الثانی ، فی ذکر عمر ، من أبواب الخلفاء ، فی وقائع السنة الثالثة عشر . ( 12 ) . [ نسخه [ ب ] ناقص بود ، روایت با کمی اختلاف از مرآة الزمان در افحام الاعداء والخصوم : 59 آمده است ، و پس از ( بالاعیسر ) آمده : وکان أکبر ذنوبه - خالد - عنده قتل مالک بن نویرة بعد اسلامه وأخذه لامرأته ، ودخوله المسجد وعلی رأسه سهام فیها دم ] .

(214) [A and B] And Sibt ibn al-Jawzi in "Mir'at al-Zaman" said: "The mention of Khalid ibn al-Walid's removal from Syria: Umar remained displeased with Khalid during the entire caliphate of Abu Bakr due to words that reached him about Khalid's contempt for him and disregard for his position, and he would call him only by his mother's name and al-A'yusr (the left-handed), and he would urge Abu Bakr to remove him and provoke him to kill him because of his killing of Malik. Abu Bakr would hesitate, but when Abu Bakr died and Umar became the caliph, he said: 'By Allah, Khalid will never hold a position again.'" In the second chapter, regarding Umar, from the Books of the Caliphs, in the events of the thirteenth year. (12). [Version [B] was incomplete, the narration is mentioned with slight differences from Mir'at al-Zaman in Ifham al-A'da' wa-l-Khusuum: 59, and after (al-A'yusr), it states: "and Khalid's greatest sins in his view were the killing of Malik ibn Nuwaira after his Islam and taking his wife, and entering the mosque with arrows on his head containing blood."].

para.p: و چون که طعن شیعه بر ابوبکر مطابق قول عمر است ، پس حاجت به دفع شبهاتی که مخاطب ذکر کرده نماند ; زیرا که نزد اهل سنت حضرت رسول خدا صلی الله علیه [ وآله ] وسلّم در حقش فرموده :

And since the criticism of the Shia on Abu Bakr aligns with the statement of Umar, there is no need to address the doubts that the Addressee has mentioned; for, according to the Ahle Tasannun, the Noble Prophet of God, peace be upon him and his holy progeny, declared regarding him:
إن الله جعل الحق علی لسان عمر وقلبه. کما فی صحیح الترمذی وغیره (215).
"Indeed, Allah placed the truth upon the tongue and heart of Umar." As found in Sahih al-Tirmidhi and other sources (215).

footnote.p: 1- [ ب ] صحیح الترمذی 2 / 215 ( طبع کانپور هند ) . [ سنن ترمذی 5 / 280 ، سنن ابی داود 3 / 20 ] . [ الف و ب ] و مولوی عبدالعلی در “ شرح مثنوی “ مولوی روم تصریح به عصمت عمر نموده حیث قال فیه : و در حدیث مروی مسلم و دیگر ائمه واقع است که : ما سلک الشیطان فجّاً إلاّ سلک غیر فجّک . . نرفته است شیطان هیچ راهی را مگر آنکه رود در غیر راه تو ای عمر . و شیخ اکبر قدوه محققان فرمود که : این حدیث نص است بر معصوم بودن او که شیطان را راه نیست در طریق وی . . . انتهی . [ شرح دفتر دوم پیدا نشد ، مراجعه شود به شرح دفتر پنجم در شرح : ( هر که نور عمرش نبود سند ) شرح مثنوی مولوی عبدالعلی 48 ورق مانده به آخر کتاب ] .

(215) [B] Sahih al-Tirmidhi 2/215 (Kanpur, India edition). [Sunan al-Tirmidhi 5/280, Sunan Abi Dawud 3/20]. [A and B] And Mawlawi Abdul Ali explicitly stated the infallibility of Umar in his "Sharh Mathnawi" of Mawlawi Rumi, where he said: And it is narrated in a hadith reported by Muslim and other Imams that: "The devil did not take any path except that he will take a path other than your path, O Umar." The devil has left no way except that he will go in a path other than yours, O Umar. And the Shaykh Akbar, the leader of the researchers, said that this hadith is a clear indication of his being infallible, as the devil has no way in his path... Concluded. [The commentary on the second volume could not be found; please refer to the commentary on the fifth volume for an explanation of: "Whoever is not the light of Umar, his evidence is not valid," in the Sharh Mathnawi of Mawlawi Abdul Ali, 48 pages remaining until the end of the book].

para.p: و از ملاحظه دیگر روایات واضح میشود که تنها نزد عمر بن الخطاب این رذالت از خالد به وقوع نپیوسته بود ، بلکه زنا کردن او با زن مالک نزد جناب امیرالمؤمنین علی بن ابی طالب ( علیه السلام ) - که مخبر صادق سرور کائنات علیه آلاف التحیات در حق او « علیّ مع الحقّ والحقّ معه » فرموده - ثابت و متحقق بود ، و دیگر صحابه مثل سعد ابن ابیوقاص و طلحة بن عبیدالله ، خالد را زانی و قابل رجم میدانستند ، و عمر بن الخطاب و جناب امیرالمؤمنین ( علیه السلام ) و سعد ابن ابیوقاص و طلحة بن عبیدالله مبایعت کرده بودند که قصاص مالک از خالد گرفته شود ، مگر به جهت ابوبکر قدرت بر آن نیافتند ، چنانچه سبط ابن الجوزی - که از اکابر و اعظام اهل سنت است - و فضائل عالیه و مناقب غالیه او بر ناظر “ وفیات الاعیان “ (1) و “ مرآة الجنان “ (2) و کتاب “ اعلام الاخیار “ (3) و غیر آن (4) مخفی و پوشیده نیست -

And from considering other narrations, it becomes clear that this vile act did not occur solely with Umar ibn al-Khattab, but rather, his fornication with the wife of Malik was established and confirmed in the presence of His Excellency, the Commander of the Faithful, Ali ibn Abi Talib (peace be upon him) – who, as a truthful informer, stated regarding him, «علیّ مع الحقّ والحقّ معه» “Ali is with the truth, and the truth is with him” – and other companions like Sa'd ibn Abi Waqqas and Talhah ibn Ubaydullah regarded Khalid as an adulterer and deserving of stoning. Umar ibn al-Khattab and the Commander of the Faithful (peace be upon him), Sa'd ibn Abi Waqqas, and Talhah ibn Ubaydullah had mutually agreed that Malik's vengeance should be taken from Khalid, but they were unable to act on it due to Abu Bakr's interference. This is as al-Sibt ibn al-Jawzi – who is among the greatest, and most respected scholars of Ahle Tasannun – and his high virtues and significant merits are not hidden or concealed from anyone who has seen "Wafiyyat al-A'yaan" (216), "Mir'at al-Janan", "A'lam al-Akhiyar" (217) and others (218). (218.1)

footnote.p: 1- مراجعه شود به وفیات الاعیان 3 / 142 .
(216) Refer to Wafiyyat al-A'yaan 3 / 142.
2- مراجعه شود به مرآة الجنان 3 / 142 و 4 / 136 .
(217) Refer to Mir'at al-Janan 3 / 142 and 4 / 136.
3- کلام کفوی در أعلام الأخیار در طعن دهم ابوبکر خواهد آمد .
(218) The words of Kifwi in A'lam al-Akhiyar regarding the criticism of Abu Bakr in the tenth will be presented.
4- مراجعه شود به فوات الوفیات 2 / 663 ، البدایة والنهایة 13 / 37
(218.1) Refer to Fawat al-Wafiyyat 2 / 663, al-Bidayah wa'l-Nihayah 13 / 37.

para.p: در کتاب “ مرآة الزمان “ (1) - که نسخه عتیقه آن به خط عرب پیش نظر فقیر حاضر است - میفرماید :
In the book “Mar'at al-Zaman” (219) – of which a rare ancient manuscript, in Arabic script is before this humble author – he says:

footnote.p: 1- قال الصفدی فی الوافی بالوفیات 29 / 121 - 122 : سبط ابن الجوزی ; یوسف بن قزغلی . . . سمع من جدّه ، وسمع بالموصل ودمشق من جماعة ، وکان إماما فقیها واعظا ، وحیدا فی الوعظ ، علامة فی التاریخ والسیر ، وافر الحرمة ، محبّبا إلی الناس ، حلو الوعظ ، قدم دمشق وهو ابن نیف وعشرین سنة ونفق علی أهلها وأقبل علیه أولاد العادل وصنف فی الوعظ والتاریخ ، وکان والده قزغلی من موالی الوزیر عون الدین بن هبیرة وروی عنه الدمیاطی . . . وهو صاحب مرآة الناس [ الزمان ] ، وأنا ممّن حسده علی هذه التسمیة وهی لائقة بالتاریخ کأنّ الناظر فی التاریخ یعاین من ذکر فیه فی مرآة . . وقال الذهبی فی میزان الاعتدال 4 / 471 : یوسف بن قزغلی الواعظ المؤرخ شمس الدین ، أبو المظفر ، سبط ابن الجوزی . روی عن جده وطائفة ، وألف کتاب مرآة الزمان ، فتراه یأتی فیه بمناکیر الحکایات ، وما أظنّه بثقة فیما ینقله ، بل یجنف ویجازف ، ثم إنه ترفض . وله مؤلف فی ذلک . نسأل الله العافیة . وقال ابن حجر فی لسان المیزان 6 / 328 : وقد عظم شان مرآة الزمان القطب التوسی . . . فی الذیل الذی کتبه بعدها بعد أن ذکر التواریخ ، قال : فرأیت أجمعها مقصدا ، وأعذبها موردا ، وأحسنها بیانا ، وأصحها روایة تکاد جنة ثمرها تکون عیانا مرآة الزمان وفی کشف الظنون 2 / 1647 - 1648 قال : مرآة الزمان فی تاریخ الأعیان ، فی أربعین مجلدا ; للشیخ أبی المظفر یوسف قز اوغلی المعروف ب : سبط ابن الجوزی ، المتوفی سنة 654 أربع وخمسین وستمائة . قال الذهبی : نراه یأتی فیه بمناکیر الحکایات ، وما أظنّه بثقة فیما ینقله بل یحسن ویجازف ثم إنه یترفض . . قال فی الذیل : وهذا من الحسد ، فإنه فی غایة التحریر ومن ارّخ بعده فقد تطفّل علیه لا سیما الذهبی والصفدی فان نقولهما منه فی تاریخهما . وفی معجم المطبوعات العربیة 1 / 69 قال : طبع من هذا التاریخ بالفوتوغراف الجزء الثامن فقط ، یبتدئ من حوادث سنة 495 إلی 654 فی شکاغو سنة 1907 م باعتناء جامس ریشار جویت مدرس اللغات الشرقیة فی کلیة شیکاغو . . . وطبع منه منتخبات مع ترجمة فرنساویة للأستاذ باربیار دی مینار ، فی الجزء الثالث من مجموعة تواریخ الحروب الصلیبیة ( باریس 1872 ) .

(219) Al-Safadi said in Al-Wafi bil-Wafat 29 / 121-122: Sibt ibn al-Jawzi; Yusuf ibn Quzghali... he heard (hadith) from his grandfather and heard in Mosul and Damascus from a group, and he was an imam, a jurist, a preacher, unique in preaching, a notable in history and biographies, of ample respect, endearing to the people, sweet in his sermons. He arrived in Damascus while he was just over twenty years old and was well-received by its people, and the children of al-Adil were attentive to him, and he wrote in preaching and history. His father, Quzghali, was one of the freedmen of the minister Awn al-Din ibn Hubayra, and he narrated from him (rawa 'anhu) al-Dimyati... He is the author of the Mirror of People [Mirror of Time], and I am among those who envied him for this title, which is fitting for history, as if one who looks into history could see in it what was mentioned in a mirror... Al-Zahabi said in Mizan al-I'tidal 4 / 471: Yusuf ibn Quzghali, the preacher and historian Shams al-Din, Abu al-Muzaffar, Sibt ibn al-Jawzi. He narrated from his grandfather and a group, and authored the book Mirror of Time, and you will see him presenting strange (munakir) stories in it, and I do not think him trustworthy in what he transmits; rather, he tends to bias (janf) and exaggerate (juzaf), then he became a rejector of (dissociation) and authored a work on that. We ask Allah for well-being. Ibn Hajar said in Lisan al-Mizan 6 / 328: The status of the Mirror of Time was greatly exalted by Al-Qutb al-Tusi... in the appendix he wrote afterwards after mentioning the histories, he said: I saw it the most comprehensive in purpose, the most delightful in content, the best in expression, and the most reliable in narration, so that its glimpse of fruits (janna thamariha) could almost be seen as clear (uyana) - the Mirror of Time. And in Kashf al-Dhunun 2 / 1647-1648, he said: The Mirror of Time is a history of notables (ta'arikh al-a'yan), in forty volumes; by Shaikh Abu al-Muzaffar Yusuf Quzghali, known as Sibt ibn al-Jawzi, who died in the year 654 (fifty-four and six hundred). Al-Zahabi said: We see him presenting strange (munakir) stories in it, and I do not think him trustworthy in what he transmits; rather, he tends to embellish (yuhsin) and exaggerate (juzaf), then he will become a rejector of (dissociation)... He said in the appendix: This is from envy, for it is of the utmost precision, and whoever wrote a history after him has merely imposed upon it, especially Al-Zahabi and Al-Safadi, and their quotations from him in their histories are evident. In Mu'jam al-Matbu'at al-Arabiyya 1 / 69, it said: Only the eighth volume of this history was printed in photolithography, starting from events of the year 495 to 654, in Chicago in 1907 CE, under the care of James Richard Jewett, a teacher of Eastern languages at the University of Chicago... Selections from it were also printed with a French translation by Professor Barbier de Minars in the third volume of the collection "Histories of the Crusades" (Paris 1872).

para.p: وقال أبو ریّاش : دخل خالد المدینة ومعه لیلی بنت سنان زوجة مالک ، فقام عمر فدخل علی علی [ ( علیه السلام ) ] فقال : إن من حق الله أن یقاد من هذا المالک (220) ، قتله وکان مسلماً ، ونزا علی امرأته علی ما ینزوا الحمام (221) ، ثم قاما فدخلا علی سعد بن أبی وقاص وطلحة بن عبید الله فتابعوا (222) علی ذلک ودخلوا علی أبی بکر ، وقالوا : لابدّ من ذلک ، فقال أبو بکر : لا أعمله (223) سیفاً سلّه الله (224) .

And Abu Rayash said: Khalid entered the city with Layli bint Sinan, the wife of Malik, and Umar stood up and went in to Ali (peace be upon him) and said: "It is a right of Allah that retribution be taken from this Malik (220). He killed him while he was a Muslim and assaulted his wife as pigeons do (221)." Then they both stood up and entered upon Sa'd ibn Abi Waqqas and Talhah ibn Ubayd Allah, and they continued (222) in that, and then they went in to Abu Bakr and said: "This must be done." Abu Bakr replied: "I will not carry out upon him (223) a sword that Allah has unsheathed (224)."

footnote.p: 1- کذا وفی خزانة الأدب للبغدادی : ( بمالک ) .
(220) Thus, and in Khazanat al-Adab by al-Baghdadi: (from Malik).
2- فی خزانة الأدب : ( امرأته کما ینزو الحمار ) .
(221) In Khazanat al-Adab: (his wife as a donkey mounts).
3- فی خزانة الأدب : ( فتتابعوا ) .
(222) In Khazanat al-Adab: (and they continued).
4- کذا ، وفی خزانة الأدب وسائر المصادر : ( لا أغمد ) .
(223) Thus, and in Khazanat al-Adab and other sources: (I will not sheathe).
5- مرآة الزمان : وقریب منه فی خزانة الأدب 2 / 25 . تذکر : از صفحه قبل قوله : ( و از ملاحظه دیگر روایات واضح میشود ) تا اینجا در حاشیه [ الف ] به عنوان تصحیح آمده است .

(224) Mir’at al-Zaman: And something similar in Khazanat al-Adab 2 / 25. Note: From the previous page, his statement: "And from considering other narrations, it becomes clear," to here is mentioned in the margin [A] as a correction.

para.p: لیکن (1) برای مزید توضیح به ابطال هر یک از آنها میپردازیم :
However, (225) for further clarification, we will address the refutation of each of them:

footnote.p: 5- مرآة الزمان : وقریب منه فی خزانة الأدب 2 / 25 . تذکر : از صفحه قبل قوله : ( و از ملاحظه دیگر روایات واضح میشود ) تا اینجا در حاشیه [ الف ] به عنوان تصحیح آمده است .

(225) This is a qualification from the previous statement - three pages earlier -: ("The objection of the Shi'a against Abu Bakr is in accordance with the statement of Umar, so there is no need to address the ambiguities that the addressee has mentioned.")

para.p: اما آنچه گفته : جواب این طعن موقوف بر بیان این قصه است موافق آنچه در کتب معتبره فن سیر و تواریخ ثابت است . . . الی آخر .

As for what he said: "The answer to this objection depends on explaining this story in accordance with what is established in the reliable books of the science of histories and chronicles..." to the end.
پس مردود است ، اولا : به اینکه اسماء کتب سیر و تواریخ که این قصه را از آنها نقل کرده ، در اینجا مذکور نساخته .
Then it is rejected, firstly: because the names of the books of histories and chronicles from which this story is narrated are not mentioned here.
وثانیاً : به اینکه علامه شمس الدین ابن خلّکان - که مخاطب نقل او را در باب اول و دیگر ابواب معتمد دانسته (2) - در ترجمه وثیمه ، حال مالک [ را ] به این وجه ذکر کرده :

And secondly: it is reported by the eminent scholar, Shams ad-Din Ibn Khallikan – whose narrations in the first chapter and other sections are considered reliable (226) – that in the biography of Wathimah, he describes the case of Malik as follows:

footnote.p: 2- تحفه اثناعشریه : 18 .
(226) Tuhfah Ithna Ashariyah: 18.

para.p: قدم – أی مالک – علی النبیّ صلی الله علیه [ وآله ] وسلّم فی من قدم علیه من العرب ، وأسلم ، فولاّه النبیّ صلی الله علیه [ وآله ] وسلّم صدقة قومه ، ولمّا ارتدّت العرب بعد موت النبیّ صلی الله علیه [ وآله ] وسلّم بمنع الزکاة ، کان مالک المذکور فی جملتهم ، ولمّا خرج خالد بن الولید لقتالهم – فی خلافة أبی بکر الصدیق . . . ، نزل علی مالک وهو مقدم قومه بنی یربوع ، وقد أخذ زکاتهم وتصرف فیها ، فکلّمه خالد فی معناها ; فقال مالک : أنا آتی بالصلاة دون الزکاة . فقال خالد : أما علمت أن الصلاة والزکاة معاً لایقبل الله واحدة دون الأُخری ، فقال مالک : قد کان صاحبک لا یقول (227) ذلک ، قال : أو ما تراه لک صاحبا . . والله لقد هممت أن أضرب عنقک . . ثم تجادلا فی الکلام طویلا ، فقال له خالد : إنی قاتلک ، قال : أو بذلک أمرک صاحبک ، قال : وهذه بعد تلک ، والله لأقتلنّک . . وکان عبد الله بن عمر وأبو قتادة الانصاری حاضرین ، فکلّما خالداً فی أمره ، فکره کلامهما ، فقال مالک : یا خالد ! ابعثنا إلی أبی بکر فیکون هو الذی یحکم فینا ، فقد بعث إلیه غیرنا ممّن جرمه أکبر من جرمنا ، فقال خالد : لا أقالنی الله إن أقلتک . . وتقدّم إلی ضرار بن الأزور الأسدی لیضرب عنقه ، والتفت مالک إلی زوجته ام متمّم ، وقال لخالد : هذه التی قتلتنی – وکانت فی غایة الجمال – ، فقال له خالد : بل الله قتلک برجوعک عن الإسلام ، فقال مالک : أنا علی الإسلام ، فقال خالد : یا ضرار ! اضرب عنقه ، فضرب عنقه ، وجعل رأسه اثفیة القدر – وکان من أکثر الناس شعراً ، کما تقدم ذکره – فکانت القدر علی رأسه حتّی نضج الطعام وما خلصت النار الی شواه من کثرة الشعر .

Malik advanced upon the Prophet (peace be upon him and his holy progeny) among those who advanced upon him from the Arabs, and he accepted Islam, so the Prophet (peace be upon him and his holy progeny) appointed him over the charity of his people. And when the Arabs turned apostate <30> after the death of the Prophet (peace be upon him and his holy progeny) by withholding almsgiving, the aforementioned Malik was among them. And when Khalid ibn al-Walid set out to fight them – during the caliphate of Abu Bakr as-Siddiq... he descended upon Malik while he was at the head of his people, the Banu Yarbua, and had taken their almsgiving (zakat) and the way they were managed, and Khalid spoke to him about it; then Malik said: I will come for the prayer (ṣalah) but not for the almsgiving (zakat). Khalid replied: Did you not know that prayer (ṣalah) and almsgiving (zakat) together are not accepted by Allah, one without the other? Malik said: Your companion used to say (227) that. Khalid said: Or do you not see that he has a companion for you?... By Allah, I had thought to strike your neck … Then they argued extensively about the matter, and Khalid said to him: I will kill you. Malik replied: Or did your companion command you that? Khalid said: And this is after that. By Allah, I will surely kill you… Abdullah ibn Umar and Abu Qatadah al-Ansari were present, and they both disapproved of Khalid's actions, their words troubling him. Malik said: O Khalid! Send us to Abu Bakr and let him be the one to judge between us, for he has sent to him others whose offenses are greater than ours. Khalid replied: May Allah not grant me success if I release you… And he advanced to Dhirar ibn al-Azwar al-Asadi to strike his neck. Malik turned to his wife, Umm Matammim, and said to Khalid: This is the one who has killed me – and she was in the utmost beauty. Khalid replied: Rather, Allah killed you by your reverting from Islam. Malik said: I am upon Islam. Khalid said: O Dhirar! Strike his neck. So, he struck his neck, and his head was placed in a cooking pot (ithfiyah) – and he had been one of the people with the most hair, as mentioned earlier – so the pot remained on his head until the food was cooked and the fire could not reach its contents from the abundance of hair.

footnote.p: 1- فی المصدر : ( یقول ) بدل : ( لا یقول ) .
(227) In the source: (yaqul) instead of (laa yaqul).

para.p: [ قال ابن الکلبی فی جمهرة النسب : قتل مالک یوم البطاح وجاء أخوه متمّم یرثیه ] (228) .
[ Ibn al-Kalbi said in Jumharat al-Nasb: Malik was killed on the day of al-Betaah and his brother Mutamm came to mourn him ] (228).

footnote.p: 1- الزیادة من المصدر و [ ب ] .
(228) Addition from the source and [B].

para.p: وقبض خالد امرأته ام متمم ، فقیل : إنه اشتراها من الفیء وتزوج به ، وقیل : إنهااعتدت بثلاث حیض ، ثم خطبها إلی نفسه فأجابته ، فقال لابن عمر وأبی قتاده : تحضران (229) النکاح ؟ فأبیا ; وقال له ابن عمر : تکتب إلی أبی بکر الصدیق وتذکر له أمرها . . فأبی وتزوجها ، فقال فی ذلک أبو زهیر الشاعری (230) السعدی – شعر – :

And Khalid took his wife, Umm Mutamm, and it was said that he bought her from the fay' and married her, and it was said that she observed aiddah of three menstrual cycles, then he proposed to her, and she accepted. He then said to Ibn Umar and Abi Qatadah: “Will you witness (229) the marriage?” But they both refused; and Ibn Umar said to him: “You should write to Abu Bakr al-Siddiq and inform him of her situation…” But he refused and married her. In this, Abu Zuhayr al-Shaa'iri (230) al-Sa'di said – poetry -:

footnote.p: 2- فی المصدر : ( یحضران ) .
(229) In the source: (حضوران).
3- در مصدر ( الشاعری ) نبود .
(230) Not mentioned in the source (al-Shaa'iri).

para.p: ألا قل لحی أوطئوا بالسنابک
Say, O tribe, who trample with hoofbeats!
تطاول هذا اللیل من بعد مالک
This night has grown long after Malik.
قضی خالد علیه بغیا بعرسه (231).
Khalid judged against him unjustly because of his wife, (231)

footnote.p: 4- فی المصدر : ( بغیاً علیه لعرسه ) .
(231) In the source: (علیه لعرسه).

para.p: وکان له فیها هوی قبل ذلک
For he had desire for her even before that.
فأمضی هواه خالد غیر عاطف
So Khalid fulfilled his lust without turning back,
عنان الهوی عنها ولا متمالک
Neither restraining his passion for her, nor holding himself back.
فأصبح ذا أهل وأصبح مالک
He awoke as her husband, and Malik awoke
علی غیر شیء هالکا فی الهوالک
With nothing – perished among the destroyed.
فمن للیتامی والأرامل بعده
Then who is there for the orphans and widows after him?
ومن للرجال المعدمین الصعالک
And who for the destitute, impoverished men?
أُصیبت تمیم غثّها وسمینها
Tamim was struck – both its lowly and its noble –
بفارسها المرجو شجب (232) الحوارک
By the loss of its horseman, the hoped-for slayer of enemies. (232)

footnote.p: 5- فی المصدر : ( تحت ) .
(232) In the source: (تحت).

para.p: ولمّا بلغ الخبر أبا بکر وعمر . . إلی آخر مامرّ نقله قبل ذلک (233).
And when the news reached Abu Bakr and Umar… until the end of what was mentioned that was conveyed before that (233).

footnote.p: 1- [ ب ] وفیات الاعیان 5 / 66 ( طبع مصر سنه 1367 ) . [ وفیات الاعیان 6 / 13 - 15 ، وأمّا ما نقله عن الکلبی فراجع جمهرة النسب 1 / 217 ] .
(233) [B] Wafayat al-A'yaan 5 / 66 (Cairo edition, year 1367). [Wafayat al-A'yaan 6 / 13-15, and as for what was narrated from al-Kalbi, refer to Jamharat al-Nasab 1 / 217].

para.p: حاصل آنکه : هرگاه که مرتد شدند عرب - بعد پیغمبر خدا ( صلی الله علیه وآله ) - به سبب ندادن زکات ، مالک از جمله ایشان بود ، و هرگاه بیرون شد خالد بن الولید برای قتال ایشان در خلافت ابی بکر الصدیق ، فرود آمد بر مالک در حالی که ‹ 31 › او مقدم قوم بنی یربوع بود ، و به تحقیق که گرفته بود زکات ایشان را و تصرف کرده بود در آن ، پس گفتگو کرد خالد او را در معنای آن ; مالک گفت : من بجا میآرم صلات را نه زکات را ، پس گفت خالد : آیا نمیدانی که به درستی که صلات و زکات با هم است قبول نمیکند خدای تعالی یکی را بدون دیگری ، مالک گفت : صاحب تو این [ را ] نمیگفت ، خالد گفت : تو نمیبینی او را صاحب خود ، قسم به خدا به تحقیق که من قصد کرده ام که بزنم گردن تو را .

The gist of it is that: whenever the Arabs became apostates – after the Prophet of God (peace be upon him and his holy progeny) – due to their refusal to pay zakat, Malik was among them. And whenever Khalid ibn al-Walid left to fight them during the caliphate of Abu Bakr al-Siddiq, he camped near Malik while he was leading the people of Banu Yarbu' and, indeed, he had been collecting their zakat and managing it. Then Khalid spoke to him in a manner regarding that; Malik said, "I will perform the prayer (salat), but not the zakat." Khalid then said, "Do you not know that truly, prayer and zakat are accepted together? God, the Exalted, does not accept one without the other." Malik replied, "Your companion was not saying this [thing]." Khalid said, "You do not see him as your companion?" By God, I certainly intend to strike your neck."

بعد از این با هم مجادله طویل کردند ، خالد گفت : به درستی که من کشنده توام ، مالک گفت : آیا به این معنا امر کرده است صاحب تو ؟ خالد گفت : این بعد [ از ] آن است ، قسم به خدا که هر آینه خواهم کشت تو را .

After this, they had a lengthy argument, Khalid said, "Indeed, I am your killer." Malik replied, "Is this what your companion has commanded?" Khalid said, "This is after [that]. By God, I will surely kill you."
و عبدالله بن عمر و ابوقتاده انصاری هر دو حاضر بودند ، و با خالد در امر مالک کلام کردند ، خالد کلام ایشان را مکروه داشت .
And Abdullah ibn Umar and Abu Qatadah al-Ansari were both present, and they spoke with Khalid regarding Malik, but Khalid disliked their words.
گفت مالک : ای خالد ! بفرست مرا به سوی ابوبکر که او حکم کند در میان ما ، به تحقیق که فرستادی تو به سوی ابوبکر کسی را که جرم او از جرم ما بزرگ [ تر ] است .
Malik said, "O Khalid! Send me to Abu Bakr so that he may judge between us. Indeed, you have sent someone to Abu Bakr whose offense is greater than ours."

خالد گفت : عفو نکند (1) از من خدای تعالی اگر از تو عفو کنیم ، و امر کرد ضرار بن ازور اسدی را تا گردن او را بزند ، پس مالک ملتفت شد به سوی زوجه خود ، و گفت به خالد : این است که مرا قتل کرده - بود [ زوجه ] او در غایت جمال - ، خالد گفت : بلکه خدای تعالی تو را قتل کرد به سبب برگشتن تو از اسلام ، مالک گفت : من بر اسلامم ، خالد گفت : یا ضرار ! بزن گردن او را ; و گردانید سر او را پایه دیگ و موی سرش از دیگر مردم زیاده بود ، و بر سرش دیگ بود تا طعام پخته شد .

Khalid said: "May the Almighty God not forgive (234) me if I forgive you," and he commanded Dhirar ibn Azur al-Asadi to behead him. Then Malik (Malik) turned towards his wife and said to Khalid: "This is who you were going to kill me for" – his [wife] in the utmost beauty. Khalid said: "Rather, the Almighty God killed you because of your turning away from Islam." Malik replied: "I am upon Islam." Khalid said: "O Dhirar! Strike off his head"; and he turned his head to the base of a pot, and his hair was longer than that of other people, and a pot was on his head until the food was cooked.

footnote.p: 1- در [ الف ] : ( نه عفو کند ) است که اصلاح شد .
(234) In [A]: (he does not forgive) is found, which has been corrected.

para.p: [ ابن کلبی در “ جمهرة النسب “ گوید : مالک روز بطاح کشته شد ، و برادرش متمم آمد و برای او مرثیه سرایی کرد ] (2) .
[Ibn Kalbi in "Jamhirat al-Nasab" says: Malik was killed on the day of Takhash, and his brother Mutammim came and recited elegies for him] (235).

footnote.p: 2- زیاده ترجمه از زیاده مصدر و [ ب ] میباشد .
(235) The additional translation is from the extended source and [B].

para.p: و گرفت خالد زن او را .
And Khalid took his wife.
و گفته شده است که : خرید او را از فیء و تزویج کرد با او .
And it has been said that he bought her from the spoils and married her.
و گفته شده است که : سه حیض عده داشت ، بعد از این ، خالد او را خواستگاری نمود و اجابت کرد .
And it has been said that she had three menstrual cycles of waiting, after which Khalid proposed to her, and she accepted.
و گفت خالد ، ابن عمر و ابوقتاده را که در مجلس نکاح حاضر شوند ایشان ابا کردند ، ابن عمر گفت : بنویس به سوی ابوبکر حقیقت حال این زن را ، خالد ابا نمود و تزویج کرد .
Khalid asked Ibn Umar and Abu Qatadah to be present in the marriage ceremony, but they refused. Ibn Umar said: "Write to Abu Bakr about the true state of this woman." Khalid refused and married her.
و ابوزهیر شاعر در این واقعه اشعار مذکور [ را ] گفته که دلالت بر ظلم و بغاوتِ (3) خالد در قتل مالک و تصرف او بر زوجه اش دارد .
And Abu Zuhayr the poet composed the mentioned verses [which] indicate Khalid's injustice and rebellion (236) in the killing of Malik and his actions towards his wife.

footnote.p: 3- بغاوت : طغیان ، سرکشی و نافرمانی . رجوع شود به لغت نامه دهخدا .
(236) Rebellion: tyranny, insubordination, and disobedience. See Dehkhoda Dictionary.

para.p: اما آنچه گفته : ابوقتاده گواهی داد که من بانگ نماز از میان قوم او شنیده ام .
As for what he said: Abu Qatadah testified that he heard the call to prayer from among his people.
پس به ظاهر دلالت میکند که تنها ابوقتاده گواهی شنیدن اذان از قوم مالک داده ، و حال آنکه در عبارت “ تاریخ طبری “ که این فاضل آن را در حاشیه نقل کرده این الفاظ واقع است :

This then appears to imply that only Abu Qatadah testified to hearing the azaan from the people of Malik, while in the passage from "Tarikh al-Tabari" (History of Tabari) that this scholar has quoted in the margin, the following words are found:
وقال آخرون : سمعناه ، وقال أبو قتاده : سمعناه (237) .
And others said: "We heard it," and Abu Qatadah said: "I heard it" (237).

footnote.p: 1- حاشیه تحفه اثناعشریه : 532 .
(237) Margin of Tuhfat al-Ithna ‘Ashariyyah: 532.

para.p: یعنی دیگران گفتند که : شنیدیم ، و ابوقتاده گفت که : ما شنیدیم .
Meaning, others said that they heard it, and Abu Qatadah said that he heard it.

و موافق قاعده مشهوره در میان اهل سنت که : روایت اثبات بر روایت نفی ترجیح دارد ، خالد را لازم بود که شهادت ابوقتاده و عبدالله بن عمر - را که نزد اهل سنت از عدول صحابه بودند - بر روایت عدم سماعت (2) ترجیح میداد و حکم به قتل مالک نمیکرد .

According to the well-known principle among the Ahle Tasannun that narration asserting is preferable to narration denying, it was necessary for Khalid to give precedence to the testimonies of Abu Qatadah and Abdullah ibn Umar – who were considered among the just witnesses in the eyes of the Ahle Tasannun – over the narration of not hearing (238) <32> and not rule on the killing of Malik.

footnote.p: 2- کذا ، و ظاهراً ( سماع ) صحیح است .
(238) Thus, and apparently (sama') is correct.

para.p: اما آنچه گفته : اینقدر خود به شهادت مردمِ گرد و نواح ، به ثبوت رسیده بود که هنگام استماع خبر قیامت اثر وفات جناب پیغمبر زمان صلی الله علیه [ وآله ] وسلّم خانه این مالک بن نویره حنابندی ‹ 32 › و دف زنی و دیگر لوازم فرحت و شادی به عمل آورده ، شماتت به اهل اسلام نموده بودند .

As for what he said: this alone had been established by the testimony of the people of the surrounding areas, so much so that at the time of hearing the news of the Day of Resurrection, the effects of the passing of the noble Prophet of the time (peace be upon him and his holy [and pure] progeny) had been in the house of this Malik ibn Nuwayrah, performing Hanbali (Hanbali) acts of celebration, such as drumming and other signs of joy and happiness, and mocking the people of Islam.
پس کذب محض و افترای صرف است .
Thus, it is mere falsehood and sheer fabrication.

و بر تقدیر تنزل از کجا ثابت شد که زنان خانه مالک بن نویره این امور را به اجازه او به عمل آورده باشند ؟ و حال آنکه در صحاح اهل سنت ثابت و متحقق است که بعضی از امور ممنوعه را عایشه بدون اذن حضرت رسول خدا ( صلی الله علیه وآله ) ارتکاب میکرد !

And even if we were to concede, how could it be established that the women of the house of Malik ibn Nuwayrah were involved in these matters? with his permission? And while it is established and verified in the Sahih of the Ahle Tasannun that Aisha committed some prohibited actions without the permission of the Prophet of Allah, peace be upon him and his holy progeny!
اگر این افعال شنیعه را زنان خانه مالک مرتکب میشدند ، و مالک تجویز آن میکرد ، خالد چرا به آن بر ارتدادش احتجاج نمیکرد ؟ !
If the vile actions were committed by the women of Malik's household, and Malik approved of them, why did Khalid not use that as an argument against his apostasy (irtidad)?!
و عمر چگونه او را مسلم میگفت ؟ !
And how did Umar call him a Muslim?!
و ابوبکر به چه وجه خالد را خاطی مینامید ؟ بلکه مصیبش میگفت ! !
And in what way did Abu Bakr consider Khalid to be in the wrong? Rather, he claimed he was correct!!
اما آنچه گفته : در حق جناب پیغمبر صلی الله علیه [ وآله ] وسلّم این کلمه گفت : ( قال رجلکم . . أو صاحبکم . . کذا ) و این اضافه به سوی اهل اسلام ، نه به خود ، شیوه کفار و مرتدین آن زمان بود .

As for what he said: regarding the noble Prophet, peace be upon him and his holy progeny, was this single statement: “ قال رجلکم . . . أو صاحبکم ... کذا” (Your man... or your companion... so on) and this addition toward the people of Islam, not to himself, was the manner of the unbelievers and apostates (murtad) of that time.
س مردود است :
Therefore, it is rejected:

اولا : به اینکه در “ تاریخ ابن خلّکان “ و “ طبری “ و “ شفاء “ قاضی عیاض تنها لفظ ( صاحبک ) یا ( صاحبکم ) مذکور است و لفظ ( رجلکم ) ذکر نکرده اند ; عبارت ابن خلّکان و عبارت “ تاریخ طبری “ سابق از این منقول شده ، و عبارت “ شفاء “ قاضی عیاض این است :

Firstly: because in "Tarikh Ibn Khalkan," "Tabari," and "Shifa" of Qazi Iyad, only the word “your companion” (sahibik) or “your companions” (sahibikum) is mentioned, and the term “your man” (rajolekum) is not mentioned; the statement of Ibn Khalkan and the narrative in "Tarikh Tabari" cited earlier have been conveyed, and the wording of "Shifa" of Qazi Iyad is as follows:
احتجّ ابراهیم بن حسین بن خالد الفقیه فی مثل هذا بقتل خالد بن الولید مالک بن نویرة لقوله عن النبیّ صلی الله علیه [ وآله ] وسلّم : ( صاحبکم ) . (239) انتهی .

Ibrahim ibn Husain ibn Khalid al-Faqih argued in a case like this with the killing of Khalid ibn al-Walid Malik ibn Nuwayra for his statement from the Prophet, peace be upon him and his holy progeny: (your companion). (239) End.

footnote.p: 1- [ الف و ب ] الباب الاول من القسم الرابع . ( 12 ) .
